story:
Since its launch in January, 2013, Ms. Fit

has been redefining women's health and fitness media. Body-positive and queer-friendly, Ms. Fit magazine addresses the health, fitness, and wellness concerns of real people living in the real world.

What You Will Find in Ms. Fit

  • Know Your Body Systems
  • Chatting with Michelle Tea About Getting Pregnant and the Families We Create
  • Do You Need to Eat That? Coping With the Family Diet Police
  • Rebirth: Black Girls Run Helps an Unlikely Runner Find Her Stride
  • Body as Weapon: Fighting Back with the Tools Close at Hand
  • "I Did It!" Reader's Stories of Personal Triumph

What You Will Not Find in Ms. Fit

  • The Fastest Way to Lose Belly Fat
  • The Real Reason Your Skin is So Oily
  • Three Weird Foods for Weight Loss
  • Lean Sexy Legs and a High Tight Tush: Get Them Faster Than Ever
  • 11 Skinny Holiday Cocktails


In its first year, Ms. Fit published more than 100 original articles ranging from feminist pregnancy and parenting to body-positive fitness, to recipes, reviews, and D.I.Y., to personal essays and practical tips and advice about wellness and healthy-living from a distinctly feminist perspective. Since January 2014, Ms. Fit's website has received over 100,000 page views from more than 40 countries. 

Ms. Fit is for intelligent women who have an interest in fitness and health but don't need Self or Women's Fitness telling them to look good for an imaginary mate. Ms. Fit skips the unhealthy stereotypical articles and instead features intelligent, body-positive observations or stories... Check out Ms. Fit Magazine. It's inspiring, positive, and queer-inclusive." -Autostraddle, May 2014

Help Ms. Fit Continue Rocking Women's Health and Fitness in 2014

Ms. Fit needs your help to continue. Like most indie-publishing projects, we are a very low-budget operation (all of our editors are volunteers) with no income. Last year, with your support, we were able to acquire high-quality, consistent web-hosting, purchase a one-year subscription to a stock photo database, and pay our awesome contributors for four issues.

This year, with your support, we will be able to renew our web-hosting service (which we've had to upgrade several times due to high site traffic), renew our image database subscription, and continue to pay our writers.

Without your support, the financial feasibility of our ongoing existence is questionable.

In 2014, we hope to continue building our platform, and to find ways to monetize the magazine to make it self-sufficient, either through advertising, sponsorships, or affiliate programs (most likely a combination of the above). Our 2014 goal is for Ms. Fit to earn enough money to sustain itself while remaining completely free to users. We also want to avoid being in any way editorially beholden to advertisers. Your will help make this possible.

On this page, you'll see lots of different support levels, with neat thank you gifts for each. Trust me when I say this: your donation of any amount, from $1.00 to $1,000,  is very much appreciated, and will make a difference.

With your help, we look forward to publishing the upcoming issues in 2014:
  • The Food and Sex issue
  • Pleasure and Pain
  • Stretch
  • The Queer Health Issue

Love Ms. Fit but too broke to donate? There are other ways you can help.

  • Spread the word about our Indie-A-Go-Go campaign. Tell your friends and family about Ms. Fit mag and post links to our fundraising page on your social media sites.
  • Join Ms. Fit's mailing list, like us on Facebook, and follow us on Twitter.

story:
BABY MILK FOR GAZA’S NEONATES

Gaza Strip is the biggest open air prison in the globe, with a population of over 1.8 million trapped into an area of 360 km2. All borders are closed, no free movement and fishing is possible in the Gaza Sea due to the Israeli navy harasses and the implemented buffer zone areas.

The humanitarian issues have been recently increased after the unstable political situation in Egypt, which has reflected directly on the Gazans by the closure of the Rafah border for long periods and destroying the life line channels by the border which were used to get the main food materials and petrol.

Due to all these ongoing progressive circumstances, the humanitarian situation in Gaza is getting up on the priorities’ pyramid. According to the ministry of Health in Gaza, the stock of medicines in the governmental medical stores has decreased and some of the items have really run out.

The most important section, which I do always focus on in my appeals, is the Children section and related issues. According to the latest statistics released by the Palestinian center bureau of statistics and Ministry of interior - Civil affairs 2013 show that 55,000 neonates were born, 51% were males and 49% were females with a rate of 25.56 births/1,000 population.

Most of these neonates are born with some genetic problems such as lack of Lactose digesting enzyme and vomiting due to abnormal conditions in digestions. “ The lack of this enzyme causes diarrhea and vomiting in the neonates who are depending on breast feeding or baby milk formulas.

They require a special lactose free baby milk formula for at least 4 months after their birth, until their bodies become stronger and can tolerate this problem.

BABY MILK FOR GAZA’S NEONATES appeal will focus on these neonates by providing them the special Lactose Free (LF or AR formula AntiRegurgitation) baby milk formula. The Gaza’s pharmacies have this kind of baby milk of various brands but unfortunately it is too expensive compared to other normal baby milk formulas. 

Many families can’t afford to buy this milk, especially those who have twins or more kids. It is also not provided by NGOs or UN medical facilities, but can only be found in the private pharmacies.

This appeal will raise funds to buy the lactose free baby milk formula and distribute it among children hospitals in the Strip.

Calculations

The total amount of the needed baby milk cans are 400-460, with each can costing from 42 to 45 NIS ~ £8

Total amount is: 478 bottles x 8= £3824, plus £378  as a 9% commission the Indiegogo website takes from the total amount if we hit the goal of 4200£ with Flexible funds option.

Gaza’s neonates are our future generation that will grow up to raise and push forward to build Palestine. Please, I’m calling all of you as my brothers and sisters to be together to achieve this goal because I believe in unity and the power of the people.

If you can’t afford, we understand, but please share and let others help through you. God rewards us all for the good deeds and forgive us for the bad ones. Amen

Coordinator

Dr.Hani Siliman Salamah
story_txt:
BABY
MILK FOR GAZA’S NEONATESGaza Strip is the biggest open air prison in the
globe, with a population of over 1.8 million trapped into an area of 360 km2. All
borders are closed, no free movement and fishing is possible in the Gaza Sea due
to the Israeli navy harasses and the implemented buffer zone areas. 
The humanitarian issues have been recently increased
after the unstable political situation in Egypt, which has reflected directly
on the Gazans by the closure of the Rafah border for long periods and
destroying the life line channels by the border which were used to get the main
food materials and petrol.
Due to all these ongoing progressive circumstances,
the humanitarian situation in Gaza is getting up on the priorities’ pyramid.
According to the ministry of Health in Gaza, the stock of medicines in the
governmental medical stores has decreased and some of the items have really run
out. 
The most important section, which I do always focus
on in my appeals, is the Children section and related issues. According to the
latest statistics released by the Palestinian center bureau of statistics and
Ministry of interior - Civil affairs 2013 show that 55,000 neonates were born,
51% were males and 49% were females with a rate of 25.56 births/1,000
population. 
Most of these neonates are born with some genetic
problems such as lack of Lactose digesting enzyme and vomiting due to abnormal conditions in digestions. “ The lack of this enzyme causes
diarrhea and vomiting in the neonates who are depending on breast feeding or baby
milk formulas. 
They require a special lactose free baby milk
formula for at least 4 months after their birth, until their bodies become
stronger and can tolerate this problem.
BABY MILK FOR GAZA’S NEONATES
appeal will focus on these neonates by providing them the special Lactose Free
(LF or AR formula AntiRegurgitation) baby milk formula. The Gaza’s pharmacies have this kind of baby milk of
various brands but unfortunately it is too expensive compared to other normal
baby milk formulas.  
Many families can’t afford to buy this milk,
especially those who have twins or more kids. It is also not provided by NGOs
or UN medical facilities, but can only be found in the private pharmacies. 
This appeal will raise funds to buy the lactose
free baby milk formula and distribute it among children hospitals in the Strip.
Calculations
The total amount of the needed baby milk cans are 400-460,
with each can costing from 42 to 45 NIS ~ £8 
Total amount is: 478 bottles x 8= £3824, plus £378  as a 9% commission the Indiegogo website takes
from the total amount if we hit the goal of 4200£ with Flexible funds option.
Gaza’s neonates are our future generation that will
grow up to raise and push forward to build Palestine. Please, I’m calling all
of you as my brothers and sisters to be together to achieve this goal because I
believe in unity and the power of the people. 
If you can’t afford, we understand, but please share
and let others help through you. God rewards us all for the good deeds and
forgive us for the bad ones. Amen
Coordinator 
Dr.Hani Siliman Salamah

story:
UniBo Motorsport is the Formula SAE team of the University of Bologna.


What is the formula SAE?

The Formula SAE Championship is an international competition, organized by The Society of Automotive Engineers that involves over 500 universities worldwide. Teams of students design and build from scratch a Formula style prototype that must follow precise rules. The competition is based on a series of tests that evaluate the car for its design quality and performance, as well as the efficiency of the project from both an economic and an engineering point of view.

Who are we?

Unibo Motorsport was founded in 2009 by a group of enthusiasts’ mechanical engineering students that wanted to create a connection between the academicals reality and the industrial one, with a particular focus on the Automotive world. Today the team is formed by about 50 students operating in five different divisions: Vehicle, Aerodynamics, Powertrain, Electronics, Marketing.

The construction of the car starts with an accurate design phase followed by the manufacturing and assembling phases. All of them require teamwork skills, crucial for a good result.

Our achievements

Our continuous commitment through years and our technical skills led us to achieve the victory in the Formula SAE Brazil in October 2014. Thanks to this award, Unibo Motorsport became the first Italian team to win a race in the competition since its birth. UniBo Motorsport is now working on the new car, the 4th built by the team, which will bring great improvements in several aspects.

Car improvements for 2015

·  The vehicle division is realizing one of the most important car development since the birth of the team: for the first time, there will be a carbon monocoque chassis, which replace the previous steel tube trellis frame solution. There will be an important review of the suspension system geometries, due to the introduction of aerodynamics and the reduction of the rims diameter from 13 ‘’ to 10’’. All these features result in many advantages; of course, the most relevant will be a significant weight reduction,which is always a very important goal in a motorsport competition.

·  Taking into account the crucial role that aerodynamics has in the car's performance, this year we decided to develop a complete aerodynamic package, with front and rear wings specifically engineered to provide the possibility to change the incidence of each profile. In this way, it is possible to modify the vehicle attitude and meet the driver’s demands.

·  The team produces all its electronic systems; this feature makes UniBo Motorsport a unique team in its kind. Thanks to the proven reliability and the efficiency of electronic systems developed during 2014 season, the activities of the Electronics division will be mainly focused on refinements. In particular, our already powerful telemetry and data-logging systems will be enhanced by the integration of an entirely new Inertial Measurement Unit, which, combined with the use of a GPS receiver, will allow us to track  the car position on the circuit and to associate a location in space to the data collected.

·  After an accurate design, the engine will finally be equipped with a new gearbox. The gearshift, properly spaced, will have four gears and will allow, with a well-defined final transmission ratio, the use of the engine in the maximum torque and power RPMs for most of the track. Thanks to studies focused on the optimization of existing models, the use of CFD simulations made possible the complete re- design of the intake and exhaust systems, mutually “tuned”, in order to improve the already excellent performance of the engine.

·  The marketing division supports the work of the technical divisions with initiatives that give visibility to the project in order to obtain the necessary support. Many companies understand the benefits of our project and have invested in the development of our work.  

Our challenge: Brazil 2015

UniBo Motorsport has a great potential, proved by results, but Motorsport is economically demanding: to build such performing cars is an engineering challenge. Moreover, taking part in competitions all around the world is onerous and it is very difficult to find the needed resources. The Brazilian competition was a very special race to us and we are doing our best to come back with a very a competitive car to defend the winners title. We need your help to meet the costs for the travel and the car shipment to South America. This is your chance to be a part of our project: YOUR SUPPORT COULD MAKE THE DIFFERENCE!”

Use the funds

The funds raised with the campaign will be used in the building phase, in the track tests, in the competition. In particular, the funds will help us in:

·  Car shipment for the Brazilian competition (more than $10.000)

·  Track tests’ costs before the competition  ($8.000)

·  Materials and components’ costs for the manufacturing

story:
On 27th September I am taking part in a seven day mountain bike endurance race in the Himalayas, India. Over the seven days, I will bike a total of 550km and climb over 15,000 metres (49,200 feet) at an altitude of up to 3,250 metres above sea level.

I am raising money for seven critically ill Vietnamese heart disease patients who are unable to afford the cost of treatment.

Heart disease is the leading cause of death in Vietnam, particularly for the poor living in rural communities who lack access to quality healthcare. Left untreated most patients will die in a few years. Treatment for heart disease is relatively simple, yet the cost is unaffordable for those with a household income of under   US$ 100 a month.

Despite some support from charitable foundations and the government insurance program, patients still have to raise around 50% of the costs. At US$ 1,540 this is unaffordable and many hundreds of patients die each year due to lack of financial support.

In the UK and other western countries, we take for granted that we would receive specialised cardiac treatment and that we would not be faced with having to raise the funds ourselves.

I am looking to raise £7,000 (US$ 10,700) which will pay for the treatment of these 7 patients to have cardiac surgery in a reputable hospital in Vietnam. The success rate for these operations is around 95%.

MTB Himalayas is rated as one of the toughest mountain bike endurance events in the world and I have spent most of the last 4 months training for the event. This has involved an indecent amount of time in wearing spandex, 5am daily alarm calls and numerous near misses with cows, bikes and buses in the congested Saigon traffic.

It would be great if you could support this worthy cause and help motivate me on the long bike climbs!

story:
Optikal makes keeping your eyes healthy easier by delivering everything you need right to your doorstep! Every three months you'll get a new box of contact lens care supplies with your Optikal subscription. Hassle-free, with no stress. As a contact lens wearer with a busy lifestyle, it's easy to find yourself slacking off when it comes to proper contact lens care. It's hard enough to keep all of your care supplies stocked and even harder to remember when to replace your lenses and my cases.                                            

Getting careless about contact lens hygiene doesn't go without consequences. In fact, nearly one million doctor and hospital visits every year are due to bacterial eye infections caused by improper contact lens care.

      

                   

 

                    

Features

 

Signing up is simple!

Step 1: Visit www.optikalcontactcare.com

Step 2: Select the option that is best for you either a Premium Box or a Simple Box

Step 3: Never worry about contact lens care supplies again!

All of our boxes come with your choice of contact solution brands*:

         or   

* More choices will be available soon!

Optikal Premium Box

Take a look at what's inside!

  

 

The Premium Box is our all inclusive, most well-rounded contact lens care package. It includes everything you need to optimize your eye health from the inside out. This system helps you remember when it's time to replace lens and cases and supplies you with useful tools so you can make healthy eyecare decisions even when you're on the go!

Premium Box Benefits:

Contact Case - Get a fresh replacement case every three months. Replace your case at least four times a year to reduce your risk for eye infections.

Emergency Contact Case - You'll always have a backup just in case something happens to the original.

Contact Solution - Your choice of high-quality, contact solution either Bausch & Lomb's Biotrue or Alcon's OPTI-FREE Pure Moist.

Travel Size Solution - An additional 2 oz travel size bottle convenient when you're on the go.

Rewetting Drops - Soothe dry contacts with Bausch & Lombs Renu or Opti-free Pure Moist drops to remoisten your lenses.

Lens Inserter - Reduce the risk of debris and bacteria transferring to your eye by using a lens inserter instead of your fingers.

Contact Lens Wipes - Keep a pack of these alcohol-free wipes in your bag or pocket for an easy and convenient way to clean your hands when you don't have access to a sink to wash your hands before handling your contact lenses. They'll come in especially handy while traveling or if you have an emergency.

Optical Hand Soap - Optometrist approved medical-grade hand soap to sanitize hands before contact lens application or cleaning.

Eyecare Gummy Vitamins - A sample of vitamins with zeaxanthin and lutein, which are essential nutrients that may reduce your risk of certain eye diseases.

Contact Lens Calendar - This is an easy way for monthly or weekly contact wearers to remember when it is time to replace their contacts.

Right/Left Contact Lens Stickers - Many of us have a different prescription in each eye. Stickers make it easy to tell which contact lens goes where at a glance. Add them to your case and the boxes you store your extra contacts in.  

 

Optikal Simple Box

Here's what you'll get!

 

The Simple Box is for those of you who want a no frills way to keep your eyes healthy. You'll just the basics delivered to right to your front door, exactly when you need them, every three months.  

 

Simple Box Benefits:

 

Contact Case - Get a fresh replacement case every three months. Replace your case at least four times a year to reduce your risk for eye infections.

Contact Solution - Your choice of high-quality, contact solution either Bausch & Lomb's Biotrue or Alcon's OPTI-FREE Pure Moist.

Travel Size Solution - An additional 2 oz travel size bottle convenient when you're on the go.

Contact Lens Wipes - Keep a pack of these alcohol-free wipes in your bag or pocket for an easy and convenient way to clean your hands when you don't have access to a sink to wash your hands before handling your contact lenses. They'll come in especially handy while traveling or if you have an emergency.

Optikal Perks

 

Do Good with Optikal

With every box ordered through Optikal, 1% of the total profit will be donated to a nonprofit.

              

We help the environment by recycling old cases. If you don't have access to recycling where you live, we'll do it for you. Send us your old cases and we'll recycle them at our local recycling center.

                                         

Meet the Founders

SueAnn Hollowell, Founder/CEO and Norman Stuart III, Co-Founder/COO

 

Founders, SueAnn and Norman, developed this business concept out of necessity. As longtime contact lens wearers, they know firsthand how easy it is for proper contact care to fall by the wayside when days get busy juggling work, family, and fun. Optikal is their way of making an impact in the lives of others with a simple solution for contact care that's convenient, easy, and worry-free.

They are not newbies when it comes to business development and management. SueAnn has run her own successful business for over 11 years and holds an MBA from Mercer University. Norman has over eight years of experience in customer service and earned a Bachelor's of Science degree from Hampton University.

Take the first step to a better contact lens care routine and keep your eyes the healthiest they can be by backing Optikal today!

www.OptikalContactCare.com

 

Risks and Challenges

Though nothing in life is 100% sure, we are confident that we have taken into account any possible roadblocks and integrated proactive strategies into our fulfillment plan to ensure that we can stick to our timeline and deliver our backers’ perks within the timeframe promised.

If, due to any unforeseen circumstances, it would not be possible to deliver in time, we are dedicated to keeping our backers informed through frequent, transparent communication every step of the way.

story:
Yoni Yoga & The Illustrious Jade Egg

Do you want the freedom and confidence of pelvic floor integrity? Do you want a toned, supple and dexterous vagina that will bring you and your lover(s) immense pleasure? Do you want to maintain and create a healthy pelvic floor with a sensually rich and enjoyable practice that will be fun, safe and effective? Then Yoni Yoga is for you. Join the revolution of empowered women willing to love themselves shamelessly and discover the hidden mysteries of this ancient practice.

  • My name is Savanna Boyle. Midwife, Yoni Yoga Instructor and Womens Health Ambassador
  • I am extremely passionate about sharing this practice because I know how it will significantly improve the quality of life of women, and as as a result their families and communities.
  • Your support will make this virtual learning platform a reality and help provide a much needed service to womens health.

After completion of your Jade Egg Foundations Course you can decide to continue with your personal practice privately or receive regular guided practices to support the devolopment of a strong practice. The course includes several guided meditations and practices.

I need funding for Yoni Yoga's Virtual Studio.

Exactly how much do I need:

  • I need $1250 USD for 1 year subsription to Namastream hosting software. I am seeking 35 women to buy Yoni Yoga's first online course at the early bird price of $50 
  • My "flex" goal includes another 9 women in order to buy a $450 head set microphone to deliver regular guided practices

Embryonic beginnings

I created this course from 3 months to 10 months postpartum with my second daughter - in the family playroom after the girls when to sleep. Although production quality is not what I envision for the future I am very proud of the end result. The content is equivalent to high end courses out there. Yoni Yoga is just a little embryo needing energy to grow.

  • If this medicine is not for you or you don't have a Yoni but what to support the Yoni cause, donations of any amount are welcome.
  • Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools, there may be a Yoni near you in need

COURSE CURRICULUM

http://yoniyoga.com/jade-egg-foundations-online...

Complete the course material at at anytime and at your own pace, you have lifetime access!

If this medicine is not for you or you don't have a Yoni but what to support the Yoni cause, donations of any amount are welcome.
Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign
Please use the Indiegogo share tools, there may be a Yoni near you in need

COURSE CURRICULUM
http://yoniyoga.com/jade-egg-foundations-online...
Complete the course material at at anytime and at your own pace, you have lifetime access!

story:
Family in Crisis

Hello my name is Ana and I am here to ask help for this young woman who was and is in crisis who said yes to life.  

Five months ago I met this young woman and I have been trying to help with what I can.  She is in an apartment now but rent and bills are due and no prospect of paying.  The baby is three weeks old and mother is still not able to work and no job prospect.  Please will you find it in your heart to donate to this mother and child so they will continue to have a roof over their heads.  Thank you and God bless you for your much needed donations.

  1. The challenges are enormous for this little angel.  Life is beautiful but baby Anne Marie needs your help today.  Please donate what you can!  Everything and anything will help no amount to small.  "IF EVERYONE GAVE A THREAD, THE POOR MAN WILL HAVE A SHIRT"

story: This campaign is to raise money for Erin Greene, who was attacked by a polar bear on November 1st, 2013 in Churchill, Manitoba. She was airlifted to the Winnipeg Health Science Center the day of the attack to receive immediate medical attention. Since she is a Montrealer who was living and seasonally working in Manitoba, she is not covered for medical transportation cost. This includes the three ground ambulance rides, as well as the air ambulance.

story:
EMERGENCY APPEAL 2- GAZA WAR 2014

After the previous appeal, focused on medicine for hospitals in the Gaza Strip which run almost out of stock, Check the links below 

https://www.facebook.com/hani.s.salamah/media_set?set=a.10203945662183042.1073741841.1266826306&type=1

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/emergency-appeal-gaza-war-2014/x/5745801

I am making one more emergency appeal. During the Israeli offensive ''Protective Edge'', several hospitals have been targeted and partially destroyed. One was also a hospital for people with disabilities. The doctors managed to evacuate them and many of them are now with their families who cannot provide them some of the necessary items. We decided to help them.

This appeal has 2 goals:

- to provide help for elder disabled people

- provide hospitals with extra and urgent needed medicines

Needed items for people with disabilities:

- Diapers different sizes ( S,M,L,XL,XXL)

- Urine catheter different sizes

- Urine bags different sizes for males and Females.

- Collective tools for Urine. 

- Talc powder and creams for skin irritation. 

- Vaseline and Massage oil. 

Needed list of additional medicine

Multivitamin Tab

Amoxicillin 750mg + Clavulanic acid 125mg Tab

Amoxicillin 500mg + Clavulanic acid 125mg Tab

Cefuroxime 500 tab

Azithromycin 250 Cap

Azithromycin 500 Cap

Fluconazole 150 mg Cap

Omega 3 Cap

Diclofenac Sod 100 Supp

Omeprazole 20mg Cap

Diclofen 12.5 supp

Trufen susp

All the bought items will be distributed according to our schedule.

If you have questions or need information, do not hesitate to contact me.

on drelmalihi@gmail.com

Facebook/hani.siliman.salamah

Twitter @hanisiliman

Coordinator and General Manager 

Dr. Hani Siliman Salamah

story:
Did you know that breast and cervical cancer kill more women each year than does HIV/AIDS in the developing world?

It's true.  And in Colombia, more than 6 out of every 10 women are diagnosed with cancer late- sometimes so late that their disease is too advanced to treat.  The medical system in Colombia is difficult to navigate, particularly for women who have limited income and limited literacy.

Who is Partners for Cancer Care and Prevention?

PFCCAP is a team of health professionals with a passion for improving access to high-quality breast and cervical cancer care.  We believe that no woman should die from cancer because of a fractured health system, and we know that with techincal support, providers across the health system can make a difference in women's health experiences!

In 2012, we teamed up with doctors, administrators and nurses at the oldest hospital in Colombia.  Together with patients and outside experts, our team is working to improve women's transit through the health system. 

This brings us to why we need YOU!

What We Need & What You Get

This year, PFCCAP has partnered with world-renown non-profit Nueva Vida, a support network for Latina women with cancer ( http://www.nueva-vida.org ).  Nueva Vida is a leading expert in patient navigation for the Latino community, and the Nueva Vida team has improved cancer programming in Virginia, Maryland, DC, Florida, Mexico and Argentina.
 
We have a chance to bring a leader from Nueva Vida ( http://www.nueva-vida.org/members.php ) to Cali to work with medical experts on the ground.  With Nueva Vida's assistance, our team can help to redefine how the health system serves women with cancer in Colombia. 

Because both PFCCAP and Nueva Vida are non-profits, we need YOU to help bring Nueva Vida to Cali.  Your support will be used for the exclusive purpose of funding a flight to Cali so that we can run Nueva Vida for hospital staff and administration.  With any contribution that you make towards our goal of $2,500, we can bring Neuva Vida to Cali three times to run in-person trainings and to support hospital personnel and patients!

The Impact

In our six-year history, we've brought free services to over 35,000 patients, and provided free surgical services to over 3,000 people.  With your help and with patient navigation, we will make a sustainable impact on cancer morbidity and mortality in Colombia!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to donate, please share this information with your colleagues and friends!  Post our campaign on Facebook!  Email it to your network, and share our website, WWW.PFCCAP.ORG with anyone you think might be willing to chip in!  Every bit counts!

story:
Our Story

We have been together for 6 years.  We met when Adam was stationed in Great Falls, Montana, serving in the Air Force and Amy was working in a home for troubled youths.  When Adam proposed, we discussed our future and decided that it would be best for our family if he left the military and found a job that provided more stability for raising a family.  Adam left the military and we married shortly after, and, with us both being in our 30's at the time, understood that if we wanted a family, it would be best to start then, so we began the journey that has brought us to this point. 

The first year, we tried to get pregnant "the old fashion way", but it did not work.  We went to see the doctor and they recommended that we continuing trying the same way for six more months.  After that, the doctors put Amy on a regiment of pills to help with fertility.  We ran through three cycles of that, increasing the doses each time.  Then the doctors recommended a shot for Amy, which resulted in more failed attempts and higher costs.  

When artificial insemination was the next option, we began to get more excited, but that was another failure and more savings gone.  Along our journey, we have continued to pay the financial and emotional expense of paid procedures and diminished hopes, all in the name of having a family.  Last month, our doctors recommended that we try In Vitro Fertilization (IVF).  The doctors say that they aren't quite sure why we haven't gotten pregnant yet, but this significantly increases the likelihood that we will conceive.  Then they hit us with the price....at least $15,000, none of which is covered by insurance.

We looked at each other and were just sick to our stomachs.  The last few years have taken such a financial and emotional toll on us that we began to feel defeated.  But, like any good dreamers, we decided it is still worth pursuing, no matter the cost. We decided we will scrimp and save every penny until we get there.  We volunteered to be infertility study participants to help offset the costs, but the few studies that are being run, we do not qualify for. We have sold items on craigslist to raise funds.  We both work full time, and every extra dollar we had went to two things before, trying to get pregnant, and paying off our mortgage early, but we are putting the latter on hold to pay for the procedure.  

How You Can Help

We have never asked anyone for money before, so this is very difficult and humbling for us. There is nothing we would not do to see each other happy and we are willing to discard our pride and ask for a contribution from strangers to help us make our dream come true.  

We are looking to raise $15,000 dollars by mid-January so that we can continue on our journey of experiencing one of life's greatest pleasures.  Even a $1 donation gets us closer than we are today. There are only two ways that we can ever show our gratitude for your donation.

First, by continuing to love and support one another and create a loving and nurturing environment to raise a child in; we vow to do that every day.  

Second, we would love to have a picture of you, so that we can build a photo album to show our child that they are loved so much that before they were even conceived, so many people supported them and wanted them to be in this world that they gave of themselves to see it happen.

Even if we fail to reach our goal of $15,000, any little bit collected will go a long way towards helping us pay for this procedure.  If we exceed our goal, the money left after the IVF procedure will be donated to Shriners Hospitals for Children, Erie, Pennsylvania to help pay the expenses of other families that have children with medical needs.

We understand how tough times are now, and if you cannot donate, perhaps you know someone who may, and if you could pass this on to them, we would be forever grateful. 


Thank you so much for taking the time to read this. God Bless You!

Amy and Adam Baker
Erie, Pa
BabyForBakers@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Frank is a former successful restaurant owner with a passion for quality and customer satisfaction and has the entrepreneurial spirit needed to make sure this product is presented to the tailgating public. It is a "why did'nt I think of that?" idea. A father of 3 and an avid football fan. Look on you tube and see the real tailgating  fan reactions in  Chicago and NY to this product. Unscripted and genuine. It is a winner.

Brian is a retired NYPD detective and has been tailgating for over 20 years. He is also the father of 3 children.He has designed and enhanced this project with his skill and knowledge of what tailgaters need. Made the first prototype out of wood for conceptual purposes, but the weight almost killed us. Brian has several ideas to help make the tailgating experience more organized and easier in his head so this is just the start.

Craig is a successful account rep for a major corporation and is a father of 5 children. His work ethic and dedication to his family and clients is unmatched. His sales skills are what will make our project a guaranteed winner. He too is a football fan and immediately saw the value of this product.

We want to bring this product to market because we know it serves the casual and die hard tailgating sports fan by making their preparation for a good time with friends just that much easier.The funds raised will launch the product with tooling and manufacturing. We already have the market in line we just need to launch.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The $225,000 will get the tooling,production,packaging,and distribution of the first 3000 Gate Mates to the retailers and wholesalers that have expressed interest in or placed orders for the Gate Mate. Each Gate Mate will be fully stocked with all the esential tools and equipment needed for tailgaters, made of durable thick plastic for ease of use,lightweight patented insert. The ones produced for the perks and rewards will be   customized/personalized according to the specific teams or personal request. The funds raised short of the goal will get the tooling and production of the minimum first 1000 will be produced. 

The Impact

The Gate Mate is a product that we have been working on for more than 24 months. It is the creation and idea of Brian Carey a retired NYPD detective and a long suffering Jet season ticket holder and fan. We have a patent pending on the design and the trademark is now registered. We have conducted extensive research and the feedback and response to the prototypes we have made and brought to various games to show tailgaters has given us the necessary market confidence to launch it for all tailgating fans to make getting organized for their games, BBQ's, concerts, and outdoor picnic events. We now have significant interest from a major race venue for 500 Gate Mates and we have to produce them as we are ready to go to market for all tailgaters. Bottom line is we need to raise the funds so we can get those first ones to market and take this working man's product to success. We understand the first ones we produce will be going to our supporters and we want to make them unique and special for the first several hundred supporters and we intend on making 3000 to sell and continue to grow the product for all NASCAR,NCAA and pro football markets. It transcends several markets, including corporate pic-nics, backyard BBQ's, camping enthusiasts.

We understand that not everyone can go the full contribution to get a Gate Mate. We would like to offer those who can contribute something to our launch a discount on the purchase of Gate Mate products. We will send those folks a  discount offer as well as add them to our newsletter to let them know where we will be particiapting in a major tailgate event. We want to meet you there and see how we can put a Gate Mate in your hands. Network with your friends so we can make things easier for them and you to enjoy the next event you tailgate at. Use the Indiegogo share tools to help.

story: An online fundraiser has been created for Jordan Coles. She is a 22 year old woman from Atoka, OK with stage 2 Paranasal Sinus Cancer. She is a single mother to a little boy named Gavin, who is 5 years old. She has been battling this for 2 years and is starting her 3rd round of chemotherapy and will need surgery for the 3rd time as well. She needs your help with medical bills and related expenses. Any amount you give would be such a blessing to her and her family. Spread the word and God bless!

story:
Zoi in media

"Applications and wearables are saturated with heart rate and blood pressure monitors which provide disjointed information, so Zoi pushes the envelope with their novel, smart feedback system." 
"Something unique!"
"Runteq created a top coach for recreational runners" (in Finnish)

This is Zoi



With Zoi, you can improve your running economy and lower your injury risk. Zoi is designed for all recreational runners who aspire to run faster, smarter and with fewer injuries. 
Zoi is the most complete and portable solution to 
  • monitor and analyse a rich set of running kinematics parameters,
  • assess running form/technique, running economy and injury risk levels,
  • get  real-time vocal feedback on running, and 
  • get personal training plans.
Zoi is a combination of a running application and lightweight running sensors. Zoi app works on iPhone and Android devices. Zoi sensors are worn on the laces of your running shoe and on a chest belt.


Zoi for everyone

Running as an immediate experience is not about miles, kilometers or how many calories you burn. Running is more about movement, using your muscles to take your body through space, feeling your strides on the ground and your heart pumping. We make no compromises in measuring and honing that experience for you.

Zoi is a fascinating wearable product for all recreational runners.  It is something never seen in market before. Zoi measures the running motion, evaluates running technique and skills, and guides towards better running economy and a healthier gait.

Zoi is perfect for runners who are passionate about

•  improving their performance,

•  preventing overuse injuries,

•  achieving their goals with smart coaching,

•  sharing their progress and highlights with their friends,

•  being forerunners on knowledge based training through Zoi Cloud, and

•  finding their running beat

Zoi is a combination of sophisticated sensor technology and smart refinement of the data produced by it. While two state-of-the-art sensors precisely capture the movement of your feet and upper body, the mobile application analyzes the data to give both casual and advanced runners actionable advice for enjoyable, injury-free running.

The no-compromise design philosophy behind Zoi is something previously seen only in scientific applications costing top dollar. We are passionate about running and improving it, so for us there is no other way. Now is your chance to help us realize our vision of affordable technology to support our runner’s instincts.


Zoi cornerstones

Running technique evaluation

Zoi gives runners exact information about their running characteristics, running economy and injury risks. Zoi measures movement untiringly and continuously follows your progress and gives useful information. Are you heel-striking, Are you overstriding,  how long strides are, how well you move in balance, how much you are bouncing. Zoi is your personal running lab that works in every environment.

Real-time smart coaching

Zoi is your personal running coach. She takes in all the available data about your gait, body movement and heart rate, then analyses it and guides you accordingly. It also asks you about your mood and problems.  She advises you towards economical and injury-free running style.

Enjoyment driven

We believe everyone should enjoy running. Zoi introduces smart and joyful exercises that strengthen your body. Zoi application includes training plans and technique cues which help you to find your optimal running beat. Everyone can achieve the flow of joyful running. Out of this ideology, Zoi was born.


Zoi sensors

Zoi sensors are wireless, lightweight and they mount to the laces of your running shoe and to the chest strap. This unique set-up makes Zoi to gather more complete biomechanics data than any other wearable solution.

The sensors have two operating modes. In Connected mode, sensors are connected to application in real-time. In Standalone mode, the sensors store your exercise and you are able to study the results afterwards.

The sensor can store exercises up to 10 hours and its operating time with one charge is 10+ hours.




Running kinematics analysis

Zoi is a combination of sophisticated sensor technology and smart refinement of the data produced by it. While two inertial state-of-the-art sensor devices precisely capture the movement of your feet and upper body, the mobile application analyzes the data to give both casual and advanced runners useful advice. Zoi can provide a comprehensive real-time kinematics analysis that has been only seen in camera-based 2D and 3D video analysis so far.

Smart coaching

Running is a skill

Over 50 % of runners suffer from overuse injuries. There is increasing scientific evidence that poor technique is one of the main components in many running-related injuries. Running is a skill and it does not typically pick up naturally. The skill can be improved.

No tricks, but incremental change

Improving running technique requires time and effort. Too big and quick changes in the way we run are harmful and may lead to injuries. You need a persistent and patient coach.

You can manage what you can measure

It is essential to understand the weaknesses and strengths of own running, but this is not enough. Scores do not tell what you should do. You need simple and actionable guiding and Zoi is your coach.

Zoi Smart coaching means:

  • Voice-based guidance during an exercise or a race. These includes gentle reminders, cheering and encouraging.
  • Close interaction with the trainee to get subjective data on feelings and conditions.
  • Personal training plans that include all the necessary elements of endurance and strength training, balance, stretching and running drills.
  • Adapting training plans based on the current situation so that it serves the best long-term progress.

Zoi analytics

Zoi is a unique endeavor to gather real life running biomechanics data. Our Cloud is ready to help you with advanced analytics.

Our mission is to find answers to interesting and unanswered questions related to running, technique and footwear, such as

•  What is my optimal speed for 5K / half marathon / marathon?

•  Can I finish a marathon in my current physical condition?

•  Are these the right shoes for me?

•  Why am I suffering from shin splits?

•  Can we predict and prevent injuries based on the data?

Running is an exciting sport that fires a lot discussion. People have strong opinions about injuries and training methodology and marketing people bring their own views into the game. Zoi brings the facts on the table.

Zoi application

Zoi app will be available for iPhone (4S and later) and Android in the first quarter of 2015. The app will be free to download. The Indiegogo supporters get free access to Zoi application features. 


Live audio & visual feedback

Zoi gives live instructions for the current workout and reminds possible problems in your running with gentle, cheering and encouraging comments. Real-time feedback is smartly selected so runner can focus on improving his/her running form.

Training Plans

A runner can choose from a variety of training plans. Zoi recommends a training plan based on the intended goal, current fitness and running technique level. A training plan may include various elements such as running, drills, strength training, or special technique sessions for activation of right muscles. The plans are being designed together with professional running coaches and technique experts.  

Training Log

All exercises are stored into Zoi training log. It is possible to import/export the exercise data to existing web-based sports diaries.

Sensing

Zoi app supports standard Bluetooth 4.0 heart rate monitors. We are actively looking for opportunities to integrate other advanced sport sensor solutions to Zoi.

Sharing

You can share workouts and technique evaluation information via Facebook, Twitter or email to your friends, physician or coach.

Testimonials



Why Zoi

Running is a very popular sport, but still huge number of runners suffers from overuse injuries. This is mostly due to wrong training (too early, too much) and poor running skills and technique. That all leads to pain and un-motivation.

We love running. We want everyone to enjoy running. Everyone deserves a personal coach. We want technology to work seamlessly. Good trainer knows you personally, and so does Zoi. 

The latest technology lets us make incredible things that were not available in the past. We put extra effort to ensure that technology gives our customers great experiences. In addition, we want to give runners the whole benefit of it all. By collecting information on running, we can learn amazing things. For example, how people are running in different locations, what running shoes are most injury-free, what drives running economy and causes overuse injuries. In this effort we collaborate with the scientists – both big data and biomechanics.

Zoi team

The history of Zoi roots back to 2010 when Tommi was choosing new running shoes in local sport store. The physiotherapist helping him recognized issues in alignment of his feet. Based on this experience, Tommi soon realized how important role running technique and skills play in running economy and injury prevention. 

Runteq was founded in 2012 to develop automatic running technique assessment. The team worked hard to bring the first non-camera based product available for its first customers. Finnish Funding Agency for Technology and Innovation supported the endeavor.

Our first product (RunLab Coach) received great feedback from scientists, fitness testing centers and coaches in Finland, UK and Ireland. But most importantly, the interest among the consumers was even higher.

Today, team has grown, but the core vision has stayed intact. We all strive to make Zoi available for everyone. Runteq is closely collaborating with Finnish electronics design house iProtoXi who bring their competence in wireless electronics and manufacturing. Evident Solutions brings supreme software development to the Zoi team.


Production plan

The development of Zoi smartphone app has been started on iOS platform. The first beta version is in testing and further implementation. We expect that Zoi will be available in App Store by end of November 2014 . The Android version will be available in March 2015.

The design of the Zoi sensors is being finalized during September 2014. The key design points are already made, but some small changes in design are possible during the final elaboration of the sensor mechanics. We have started negotiations with contract manufacturers.

We are in a process of testing our new sensor electronics and bringing our advanced kinematics algorithms onto the embedded platform.

The key milestones of production are described below.

 


Risks and challenges

Our team has a very strong engineering and product development background that spreads in algorithm design, signal processing, mobile and server software, electronics, mechanics and manufacturing. There is no recognized technology risks.

We are confident we can will make Zoi app available in Nov 2014 for iOS. The Zoi sensor development is progressing quickly and based on the discussion with contract manufacturers it is realistic to plan the first shipments for February 2015.

Stretch goals

100 000 euros - Great! Match your Zoi to your other gear and garments. We make available new stylish color versions of sensor cradle as own perks at a special price for the supporters.



200 000 euros - Excellent! We will make Zoi apps for Android Wear and Apple Watch happen during the first half of 2015.



Thank you for your support

Thank you for your time and strong support for realizing our joint dream. Zoi can change the life of millions of runners.  For us, Zoi is a true labor of love. With more and more people sharing our enthusiasm, we know we are on the right track. We welcome your questions, ideas and suggestions. Let us keep in touch!
story_txt:
Zoi in media




"Applications and wearables are saturated with heart rate and blood pressure monitors which provide disjointed information, so Zoi pushes the envelope with their novel, smart feedback system." 
"Something unique!"

"Runteq created a top coach for recreational runners" (in Finnish)
This is Zoi

With Zoi, you can improve your running economy and lower your injury risk. Zoi is designed for all recreational runners who aspire to run faster, smarter and with fewer injuries. 



Zoi is the most complete and portable solution to 

monitor and analyse a rich set of running kinematics parameters,

assess running form/technique, running economy and injury risk levels,
get  real-time vocal feedback on running, and 
get personal training plans.



Zoi is a combination of a running application and lightweight running sensors. Zoi app works on iPhone and Android devices. Zoi sensors are worn on the laces of your running shoe and on a chest belt.



Zoi for everyone
Running as an immediate experience is not about miles, kilometers or how many calories you burn. Running is more about movement, using your muscles to take your body through space, feeling your strides on the ground and your heart pumping. We make no compromises in measuring and honing that experience for you.

Zoi is a fascinating wearable product for all recreational runners.  It is something never seen in market before. Zoi measures the running motion, evaluates running technique and
skills, and guides towards better running economy and a healthier gait.
Zoi is perfect for runners who are
passionate about
• 
improving their performance,
• 
preventing overuse injuries,
• 
achieving their goals with smart coaching,
• 
sharing their progress and highlights with their friends,
•  being forerunners on knowledge based training
through Zoi Cloud, and
•  finding their running beat

Zoi is a combination of sophisticated sensor technology and smart refinement of the data produced by it. While two state-of-the-art sensors precisely capture the movement of your feet and upper body, the mobile application analyzes the data to give both casual and advanced runners actionable advice for enjoyable, injury-free running.
The no-compromise design philosophy behind Zoi is something previously seen only in scientific applications costing top dollar. We are passionate about running and improving it, so for us there is no other way. Now is your chance to help us realize our vision of affordable technology to support our runner’s instincts.

Zoi cornerstones
Running technique evaluation
Zoi gives runners exact information about their running characteristics, running economy and injury risks. Zoi measures movement untiringly and continuously follows your progress and gives useful information. Are you heel-striking, Are you overstriding,  how long strides are, how well you move in balance, how much you are bouncing. Zoi is your personal running lab that works in every environment.
Real-time smart coaching
Zoi is your personal running coach. She takes in all the available data about your gait, body movement and heart rate, then analyses it and guides you accordingly. It also asks you about your mood and problems.  She advises you towards economical and injury-free running style.
Enjoyment driven
We believe everyone should enjoy running. Zoi introduces smart and joyful exercises that strengthen your body. Zoi application includes training plans and technique cues which help you to find your optimal running beat. Everyone can achieve the flow of joyful running. Out of this ideology, Zoi was born.

Zoi sensors

Zoi sensors are wireless, lightweight and they mount to the laces of your running shoe and to the chest strap. This unique set-up makes Zoi to gather more complete biomechanics data than any other wearable solution.
The sensors have two operating modes. In Connected mode, sensors are connected to application in real-time. In Standalone mode, the sensors store your exercise and you are able to study the results afterwards.
The sensor can store exercises up to 10 hours and its operating time with one charge is 10+ hours.














Running kinematics analysis




Zoi is a combination of sophisticated sensor technology and smart refinement of the data produced by it. While two inertial state-of-the-art sensor devices precisely capture the movement of your feet and upper body, the mobile application analyzes the data to give both casual and advanced runners useful advice. Zoi can provide a comprehensive real-time kinematics analysis that has been only seen in camera-based 2D and 3D video analysis so far.

story:
you know yoga changes lives because it changed yours

At Yoga Outreach we think everyone should have the opportunity to experience the wonderful benefits of yoga. What started out as a labour of love in the 90's has continued today as a passion for compassion.

Yoga Outreach partners with yoga instructors, community organizations, social service agencies, and correctional facilities to provide mindfulness-based yoga programming for our community’s most underserved members.

Donna Farhi said, “No matter who we are or how long we have been entrenched in self-defeating behaviours, through daily Yoga practice we can become present to our own fundamental goodness and the goodness of others.”

This is what Yoga Outreach offers each person no matter who they are or what their circumstance is. When a YO teacher goes into the Vancouver Woman’s Health Collective in Vancouver’s downtown Eastside to teach a weekly class we know it makes a difference. We know this because the VWHC Director has told us that some of the women say they don’t drink the night before they come to yoga, that they look out for each other, and that they look forward to seeing one another. Yoga Outreach provides human connection and affirmation in a world where increasingly we have none. 

The day to day work of keeping Yoga Outreach not only running, but growing, can sometimes be a strangely disconnected experience. We do a lot of number crunching, make phone calls, and answer a seemingly un-ending barrage of emails. In this never-ending parade of small tasks it’s easy to lose sight of the big picture: Yoga Outreach exists to serve others. That is why we are here. 

The fact of the matter is too many great organizations go down because they can’t find the money to go on. Your contribution can keep us moving towards a day when everyone has access to yoga regardless of their financial, physical, or emotional means. 

We have some fantastic perks aside from the warm fuzzy feelings you will have from joining our community. Our world famous Rhubarb Coffee Cake recipe is worth its weight in gold! We have some great new t-shirts, our signature scent as well as discounts and passes to upcoming yoga workshops, trainings, and events.

Here's what students are saying about their YO classes

Students at the Vancouver Women’s Health Collective (VWHC)–
“Having yoga in the DTES [Downtown Eastside] for women that is accessible and free is saving my life. My physical well-being is so enhanced with the stretch, strength and relaxation. When I feel better my outlook is more positive and I can struggle with being a single mom on welfare with enhanced vigour. It's cool to meet other women too!”

“This damaged soul finds healing in a safe, calm environment. Enriching my life and building strength from the acceptance and kindness from the teacher and the group. Thank you.”

About our students

Since 1996 we have facilitated approximately 17,000 yoga classes at no cost to our students. As students of yoga ourselves we came to love the way yoga made us feel and we wanted to share that with everyone! Yoga Outreach was born out of that and we remain committed to making yoga as accessible as possible. 

When asked if their YO yoga class left them with an overall good feeling 92% of students said YES! When asked if they would recommend their YO yoga class to others 95% of students said YES!

Our students have told us that they would not be able to attend yoga classes without YO. Simply removing the cost is not enough, our students face other challenges in accessing mainstream yoga classes. Many of our students have experienced violence, have mental health challenges, or are struggling with addiciton and they need teachers that recognize and understand this. They need teachers who are able to share yoga with them in a way that is safe, supportive, and nurturing. Things that you are I might experience positively like having a teacher adjust your posture or call you by name in class can be down right terrifying to someone who has experienced abuse. 

What YO creates is a safe space for people from all walks of life to experience the positive and healing benfits of yoga - we meet them where they are at and support them to find themselves on the mat.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't make a financial contribution? Make some noise instead! Help us spread the word, tell your friends, offer to volunteer for events, join our mailing list and attend an event, join the YO community ~ together we can make change possible, one mat at a time.

Please note we are only able to issue Canadian tax receipts if you make a contribution through PayPal. If you donate with your credit card we cannot issue a tax receipt. All Canadian donations over $25 are eligible for a tax receipt.

story:
Our Story

Going Back home was formed after several parents of long term hospitalised children realised that there was no support services for the parents or care givers of these patients when it came time to Go Home. The group was formed to help raise awareness of the needs of caregivers and to provide products and services to assist in the transition from Hospital life to the real world.


The Impact

The Transition from hospital life to the real world can be daunting. We have already met several other parents who financially and emotionally find it hard to transition back to normality - IF it can ever happen again. Going Back Home has been set up to fill the gap and provide a helping hand where possible. We have a large number of volunteers already waiting to be able to assist where required. Going Back Home has designed a series of Carer Folders and additional methods to assist the care giver when it comes to dealing with the myriad of medical, financial, social work and social security paperwork that is generated after such an event. Our main goal is simply to get the folders prepared ready for purchase and/or gifting to care givers where possible.


What We Need & What You Get

Going Back Home needs to purchase materials and printing to make the Folders available. All donations will be going into the purchase of the folders. Once the folders are completed we will be starting distribution to those in need. For those who donate we will be offering a position in our Founding Funding members page if you choose to take it up. These positions will be split into various levels depending on donation made. Once you have purchased this place it will remain there for a period of no less than 2 year from the initial date.


Other Ways You Can Help

Going Back Home will need to have plenty of Word of Mouth advertising as well as we will be needing locals who are willing to assist with the compilation, making and distribution of the Folders.

story:
Bikram Beginning Yoga Class is designed to heal every cell, every tissue and every organ in the human body!  Hare Krishna :)

BShort Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Thanks for checking up on us! My name is Matthew Miner and I am the co-founder of Bosky. Outside of being an avid fan of the outdoors, my passion towards Bosky stems from my career focus. I am currently studying renewable material science at Oregon State University and am about to kick off my senior year! Call me overeager, but I just couldn't wait until graduating to start applying what I've learned. 

The idea for Bosky grew from a discussion with one of my best friends, and Bosky co-founder, Alex Cruft. Despite living in the environmentally conscious city of Portland, Oregon, we both noticed substantial shortcomings in the green movement. We noticed how prevalent plastic has become in our society, along with the current consumerism fueling its production. A heavy emphasis has been placed on recycling, however, less is mentioned of making plastic products out of alternative materials. For this reason, we made it our mission to reduce plastic consumption and demonstrate that superior products can be made with renewable, eco-friendly materials. Over the last year, we have put our idea into action. Currently, Bosky boasts a line of renewable sunglasses made exclusively out of exotic hardwoods. To make this use of alternative materials more sustainable, we have partnered with Trees for the Future foundation. For each pair of sunglasses sold, a tree is planted!

The frame of the renewable goggles will be produced using a specially engineered bioplastic that is based on 60% renewable plant materials, specifically castor bean oil. Castor oil plastic is significantly more durable and longer-lasting than petroleum-based plastics. An added benefit of castor bean oil is that it does not interfere with food sources as compared to corn plastics. This bioplastic will outperform standard petroleum-based plastics used in all other snowboard goggles. The reason for this is due to its better flexibility at lower temperatures, something every snowboarder and skier knows is important. Another source of innovation, the thermal ventilation system in the goggles will be made from a 100% hemp fiber textile which is not only renewable, but UV resistant, far stronger, and longer lasting than polyurethane foam in all other goggles. With a little help, we will be able to accomplish something never done before, and continue to spread our ideals of original renewable optics! 

If you would like to know more about our campaign and our future goggles, feel free to contact us at press@boskywoodwear.com or call us at (503) 949-1357. 

Cheers! 


The Need and the Difference.


So what brings us to Indiegogo you ask? 

YOU!

We want to grow our company and our message, but we need some help.

The goal of $2,000 was set to cover expenses for the molding process, bioplastic, and lenses.

  • $400 for the bioplastic compounding
  • $600 for the polarized, anti-scratch, anti-fog, double-pane vented lenses
  • $1000 for bioplastic molding injection process. 

About a months time and they will be ready to wear!

Aside from manufacturing costs, a portion of all donations will support one of our charities we have partnered with. To aid the environment, we donate to Trees for the Future, which works to restore rain forest ecosystems. Other than giving back to the environment, we also seek to give back to people. For this reason, we donate to the Helen Keller International foundation, which provides prescription glasses and cataract surgeries to individuals in third world nations. 


The Recap.


Contributors to our goggles will have access to a one of a kind performance frame that uses environmentally conscious renewable materials. We have the opportunity to become the first company that produces completely renewable eyewear frames. Our ultimate goal is to spread the idea of using not only renewable eyewear, but embracing the idea of using all things that are sustainable! With every donation, you will be contributing to one of our two different partnership charities. One of these charities focuses on blindness surgeries, and vision correction for under privileged individuals, and the other plants trees to restore important rain forest ecosystems.

We realize that not everyone can contribute financially, as we are also on quite the budget ourselves! However, if you still see the value and potential of our dreams like we do there is still something you can do to help. You can can choose to share our campaign on any of your social networks or by telling friends and family. Anything you can do to get the word out is still considered a donation to us. The Indiegogo share tools can be quite helpful for this as well!

For more information, visit us at 

www.boskywoodwear.com
story_txt:

I am currently studying renewable material science at Oregon State University and am about to kick off my senior year! Call me overeager, but I just couldn't wait until graduating to start applying what I've learned. 
The idea for Bosky grew from a discussion with one of my best friends, and Bosky co-founder, Alex Cruft. Despite living in the environmentally conscious city of Portland, Oregon, we both noticed substantial shortcomings in the green movement. We noticed how prevalent plastic has become in our society, along with the current consumerism fueling its production. story:
Short Summary

My name is Alycia Sullivan and I am a 21 year old Senior at Merrimack College. This year, I'm planning on running the LoziLu 5k Women's Mud Run on July 27th. My cousin Chrissy died of leukemia when I was younger and I wanted to run and raise money for L.I.F.E. in memory of him. So many people lives are touched my cancer and which leaves a permanent mark. I look to make the best of the situation and take part in fundraisers, such as LoziLu, to help spread leukemia and cancer awareness and help find a cure. 

LoziLu is a partner of L.I.F.E. or Leukemia Ironman Fundraiser for Eric. It raises money for those diagonsed with leukemia or any kind of cancer ages 18 to 30 years old and provides them with funds to help with medical bills as well as provide information and education on cancer. They also assist in making people's last wishes or bucket list come true. 

What We Need 

We are looking for:

  • A donation
    • Any amount counts!
    • We're aiming for $500. The more the better!
  • Join my team and run! 
    • Just ask me what the team name is and I'll give you the password to join!
  • If you want me to add a name to the gift so it can also be in memory of them, please let me know. I'd be more than willing to do that! 
  • For you to spread the word to all your friends, neighbors, and family!

The Impact

LoziLu promotes a healthy lifestyle in a fun way while raising money for a charity that helps ease the pain of cancer. 

Your donation with help:

  • A family in need of funds to pay medical bills
  • Spread information and education of leukemia and cancer
  • Advocate for cancer awareness
  • Help someone's final wishes and dreams come true
  • Make a BIG difference in someone else's life

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it's okay! Please spread the word to others!

You can also:

  • Come watch us run!
    • It costs only $5 and it goes to a good cause!
  • Volunteer
    • If you volunteer, you can run for free (if you're a lady!)
    • If you're a guy, you let a lady in your life run for free!

story:
My name is Zaquan Holman and I'm 19. I was Born in Massachusetts. Raised by both parents with a very tight bond. So about a year ago my mother was diagnosed with Stage IV Lung Cancer, and ever since then nothing has been the same at all. I've never seen my mother struggle so much in life until now. She has good days and bad days, but recently things haven't been looking too good.  The past year was very difficult for her as well as the rest of the family and loved ones. Chemotherapy, radiation as well as other treatments have really took a toll on her. Weekly trips back and forth from hospitals in Fitchburg, Leominster and Worcester. But she's a very strong woman and I love her for that. She means the world to me, and all I ever wanted to do was make her proud and keep her safe.

My parents never had a legitimate wedding before or after they had me, so I wanted to do something for them before anything tragic might happen. I know it would make her extremely happy, and I know it would make a huge impact on everything overall. They've always wanted to have one, but unfortunately money and times are and have been tight. I figured that any help would be an excellent start. 

But If the limit couldn't be reached, than the money will be donated to a Cancer Society of my family's choice, and or to medical bills. If however you cannot make a donation.. Please spread the word and try to help a family in need. Please and Thank You!

 God Bless!

story:
Spree is the next evolution in fitness technology.  Traditional bracelet pedometers cannot measure your performance if you are biking, lifting weights or a myriad of other activities.

Spree is a revolutionary fitness device that analyzes the three most important variables in every fitness routine – body temperature, movement and heart rate – all in one single, integrated device.  This results in real information. 

 

Spree is destined to become the new “must have” workout companion for anyone serious about maximizing the results from their training routines.

 

 

For a limited time, special Spree - Founders Editions will be available exclusively from Indiegogo.  All Founders Editions will be uniquely marked, come with a Founders Certificate in addition to the unique perks offered in the various packages described on the right.  Be one of the first to have this class leading device, and receive yours a full month before they hit the stores.

Traditional bracelets, armbands and chest straps are fine for tracking either motion or heart rate, Spree is the only product that combines these together with body temperature resulting in the most comprehensive suite of data available.  With this data you can find where your body burns the most calories, what effectively strengthens your muscles, and the pace that gives you better endurance. All this in an easy to use headband, that you just grab and go – everything else is completely automatic. 

The data captured from your head is organized in a way that charts your exertion and gives you visual indicators when you hit your goals in each area of activity.

Features include Body Temperature, Distance Traveled, Speed, Time, Heart Rate, Calories Burned, Optimal Work Out Zones, and more. All of this data is captured in our headband unit that is simple to wear and designed for comfort and accuracy.  The data is available in real time on Smartphone App.

Stop using multiple devices or the frustrations inherent in traditional chest straps.  Get Spree and see you it can help you move your performance to the next level.

story:
Short Summary

I am a 28 year old female with Cerebral Palsy. I received a Bachelors and a Masters from the University of New Orleans in Sociology. I require 24 hour personal care attendant services through the Louisiana NOW Wavier to live and work independently. I am currently employed as an online Sociology instructor for Texas A&M Central. I was accepted into the University of Illinois at Chicago's Ph.D. in Disability Studies Program for Fall 2012. However, I had to defer my acceptance until Fall 2013 because my request to utilize my services while in school was denied by the Louisiana Department of Health and Hospital. I have been denied my dream. 

I have deferred my acceptance until Fall 2013 (August 2013). If I am unable to move to Chicago by August 2013. I will have to reapply and my education will bev put on hold yet again. It is my goal to raise enough money to pay for my attendants for one semester in order for this not to be the case.

Here's my story in Huffington Post in more detail:

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/ada-mcmahon/educa...

What We Need & What You Get

Every dollar raised will be used to fund my care for my first semester (hopefully more, if need be).

The Impact

Too often people with disabilities are limited by their physical boundaries that stunts their capability. It is my hope that my story will be the one to initiate change.

Other Ways You Can Help

Pass my story along to anyone willing to listen and.or wanting to help. Also, please sign my petitions: http://www.thepetitionsite.com/takeaction/404/390/332/ and http://www.change.org/petitions/louisiana-department-of-health-and-hospitals-to-use-my-personal-care-attendant-now-wavier-services-while-in-school

story:
Short Summary

Claire has been a driving force in creating circles of caring at Creative Visions Foundation for years.  In addition to providing loving, healing energy and emotional support, she has garnered resources for complementary alternative treatments, diet and spiritual well being.

 

Now, Claire is facing a major medical crisis of her own.  Taking everything she has learned from her experience with others, she is now going to catch a miracle of her own – while creating a journal that can be personalized for others to create a HealthTrek of their own.

 

With the support of Kathy and Amy Eldon (authors of the award winning series that included Soul Catcher, a journal to help you become who you really are) Claire will create an inspirational journal that follows her own personal journey to perfect health.

 

Your funds will allow Claire to begin drafting the book while she goes through the process of discovering a health issue, transforming the issue into a positive force, and restoring balance to mind/body/spirit for perfect health.

 

What We Need & What You Get

$12,000 will provide Claire with supplemental income to allow her to take time to write the book and chronicle her journey.

The Impact

The book will be available to help many others who find themselves having to sort through a medical crisis.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is just a part of what you can do -
Post this on facebook
Send us your inspirational stories / videos

Tell us what makes you laugh . . . and link us to it!

Please use the  Indiegogo share tools!  They act as a force multiplier for us and allow us to benefit many others.
