story:
Transforming & Healing Lives

The Noble Touch (www.thenobletouch.com) provides a holistic approach to health and wellness. We use an Energy Medicine modality called Pranic Healing which is a no touch, natural and alternative way to improve your physical, spiritual, mental and emotional well-being by eliminating stress.  Did you know that the medical community states that 85% of all major illnesses are stress related?  Imagine the stress of life and years of emotional baggage just melting away in a minutes.

Our $1100 Campaign is to help pay for the registration fees ($800) and materials ($300) for The Noble Touch to provide FREE stress relief sessions at the 10th Anniversary of the Circle of Sisters Expo (www.circleofsisters.com) held in New York City at the Jacob Javits Convention Center on October 4th and October 5th, 2014.  We are committed to serving and helping people transform by offering an alternative method of healing.  At the 2012 Circle of Sisters event, we worked with and introduced Pranic Healing to 254 attendees and 365 people in 2013.  This year it is estimated 30,000 people (record numbers) will attend the annual event and our goal is to provide FREE mini sessions to at least 600 attendees. 

Every penny we receive counts, so even if we don't reach our goal we will still attend Circle of Sisters and provide FREE mini sessions. The funds will also help support our attendance and provision of FREE services at the various health fairs and community events that we attend throughout the year.

More About The Noble Touch

    This year to date, our volunteer core of trained Pranic Healing practitioners have provided stress relief treatments to over 650 people at community health fairs and events with Health First, Mount Sinai Hospital, Downstate Hospital, Harlem Hospital, First Corinthians Baptist Church in Harlem, Mount Pisgah Baptist Church in Brooklyn and many more. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    The power to affect the health and wellness of YOU, YOUR family and others is within your reach. Please share this campaign information with your family and friends.  You can also prioritize your health and reach out to learn more about Pranic Healing. 

    Your support of The Noble Touch Healing is greatly  appreciated.

story: My friend has a son Flynn who is just a toddler and he will soon be undergoing a very complicated and rare heart surgery. He has a heart condition known as a Left Ventricular Diverticulum. Flynn developed two left sides of his heart, both working right alongside the right. But Flynn continues to be at risk of stroke, heart attack, and rupture. For anyone that knows the Hathaway Family, you don't need me to tell you how wonderful they are. Let's raise some funds (any little bit helps) to make their journey a little easier. It can help with medical/travel expenses,  or maybe even a little family trip after he recovers! Or really any expenses they run into because we all know how expense hospital stays can be... Please help them out with anything you can.  You can donate as little as $1.  This is an amazing family and I want to help them so much!

story:
Summary

Rotaract is a community service club for young adults who seek to make a difference in their communities while developing leadership and professional skills. Each year, members of Rotaract clubs (called Rotaractors) in Ghana, Benin, Niger and Togo, collectively known as Rotaract District 9102, come together for the District Assembly and Conference (DAC).

On Saturday, April 18, 2014, conference attendees will undertake a Diabetes & Hypertension Screening exercise for some 1,500 people in the Adaklu Township which consists of the following communities – Alavanyo, Tsrefe, Goefe, Abuadi, Agblefe, Helekpe and Asikaman.

Prevalence rates for diabetes and hypertension in Ghana are high at 4 and 28 percent respectively, making them major health issues. Low levels of awareness, limited opportunities for screening, poor diet and lifestyles have contributed to such high prevalence rates. The goal is to increase awareness about these conditions - causes, prevention and management, provide free screening and give food supplements.

What We Need & What You Get

A total of $5,000 will be required to purchase small equipment, medical supplies and food supplements for the 1,500 beneficiaries.

  1. Glucometer (20)
  2. Glucometer strips (40 boxes)
  3. Digital Sphygmomanometer (20)
  4. Hand washing basins (10)
  5. Disposable gloves (15 boxes)
  6. Mentholated spirit (10 bottles)
  7. Hand sanitizer (10 bottles)
  8. Gauze (10 packs)
  9. Food supplements

We'll be sending tokens to donors, including exciting pieces of art and post cards of photos taken from tourist attractions within the beneficiary communities.

The Impact

1,500 people in these rural communities will be screened for free, increasingly the likelihood that they go on to seek treatment if necessary. Disease Prevention and Treatment is one of Rotary's Areas of Focus, hence our commitment to helping people get screened to enable them make better dietary and lifestyle choices and get treatment as necessary.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate you for spending your time to read this even if you're unable to make a donation. Please share our campaign and help spread the word. Many thanks.

story: When I was 3 days old I had heart surgery on my aorta, in 2011 I was rejected from military service due to that heart surgery and spinal damage from extra bone growth in my bottom vertebrae. In early 2014 I was told I had a VSD that was becoming larger and had to patched before it effected my health. I one day may have to have my aortic valve replaced as well. I am raising money to pay off the initial cost of my tests leading to heart surgery, the surgery, and the post operation costs that have followed. Ultimately if I were blessed enough to raise more than the $10,000 for the medical bills I would like to use that money to go to college for mechanical engineering. I hope to own my own successful business one day and eventually contribute to prosthetics research and prothetic charity for veterans.

In early 2014 I was told I had a VSD that was becoming larger and had to patched before it effected my health. I one day may have to have my aortic valve replaced as well. I am raising money to pay off the initial cost of my tests leading to heart surgery, the surgery, and the post operation costs that have followed. Ultimately if I were blessed enough to raise more than the $10,000 for the medical bills I would like to use that money to go to college for mechanical engineering. I hope to own my own successful business one day and eventually contribute to prosthetics research and prothetic charity for veterans.

story:
My little goddaughter was born as a premature and she tends to be ill more than other children, probably because of this. Primarily she gets respiratory diseases. Unfortunately she’s been spending her time home every two weeks recently because of her sickness and she can’t attend nursery either.

On the photo: Susie in front of those parts of the house where her future room is hopefully going to be located. It’s unfortunately pretty ruined and uninhabitable now.

About half a year ago, my nice, talkative and always smiling little goddaughter, the three-year-old Susie told me about her little friends at nursery when she arrived home from there. She told me they all had their own rooms and then grabbed my hand and showed me her small tent she recently got as a gift. It was set in the corner of the family’s living room. She told me that was her room.

She invited me in and kept talking to me.

As she cannot speak so well yet, I did not understand half of it, but I was nodding the whole time. I liked her enthusiasm about showing me her “room” - her small tent.

On the photo: Susie’s „room”. She had run out of the photo because she was currently playing.


Her dad was smiling about it, and told me it had been going like that for a couple of weeks. Susie, lack of an actual room, has appointed that tent as her room.There was a mattress and a lot of her toys in the tent.It was quite funny but on the other hand, it also tear me down. I felt sorry for her despite her enthusiasm. I know she sleeps on the couch with their parents in the living room and all her toys and clothes are there, too. She only wishes she had an own room.

Their house is tiny and a big part of it is still quite ruined and uninhabitable. These parts are separated from the habitable parts.

Unfortunately, the rooms that are already reconditioned also get wet at some places. This is not good for Susie at all. The family has to fight with mildew and powder every day.

Susie’s father aka my brother apologetically told me that they had been sparing money for broadening their house for three years, once they realized they were going to have a new born child. The reason they had been sparing money for such a long time was because they did not want Susie having to sleep in the living room at the age of three or four. They wanted her to have her own room.

They would also have to solve this new problem. They have to build a waterproofing system all around the house which would also cost a lot.

Susie has a fifteen-year-old sister, whom they were able to build her own room for after a really long time of sparing money. This could only come true by seven years time of sparing. She is a big girl and she learns a lot so she is good at school but for this, she needs silence and calm. She cannot share her room with her always active sister.

My brother and his wife work a lot but unfortunately they still cannot afford this.

They have had the same jobs for thirteen years now and they are both honored employees but their salary is still not enough to be able to collect at least half of the money needed in the next few years. The building of the room and the waterproofing system around the whole house is a huge stretch for them.

They decided to take up bank loan but since their house is already loaded by mortgage (they have taken it up to recover the bad conditioned house they bought for a little amount of money) and neither of their salary is high enough, the bank is not capable to give them loan again.

It makes my brother disappointed that he cannot give Susie a lot, not even an own room.

Mostly, all they can give to her is love. The girls get clothes and toys from family members and close friends. Their parents are always happy to get these things because in this way, they can spare more money for the making of Susie’s room.

As I recently found out, this house extension is not a small deal, not even for one room.

Demolition permit from the authority, construction permit, plan of an architect, materials and specialists are all needed for the extension.

The cost of all of this is at least 14600 dollars. The family currently has 2700 dollars out of this. They had been sparing this amount of money for three years. (Her mother stayed at home with Susie in the meantime and she could not work.)

Building the whole waterproofing system around the house cost another 3800 USDs.

Susie’s dream and health depends on this 18400 dollars.

I’m trying to collect the missing 15700 dollars for them. I would like to help them.

No matter how much money they actually get, they get one step closer to their purpose with every single dollar.

If a miracle happens and more money is being collected, the parents could possibly build their own bedroom, too.

I know they deserve it. I really want to see Susie’s smile as soon as possible, as she’s guiding me to her actual own room. That would be such a heart-warming feeling. I pray for her health and happiness every day.

I’m not very familiar with social funding websites but I thought I would try to collect a little money for the family to make Susie’s dream come true.

They are a happy family, living in love. The most important thing to them really is family and they always try to do their best to keep themselves happy.

I thought it was important to mention.

I really want to help them a bit with my small try to make their lives easier and to make Susie even happier.

It could happen.

I’ve asked my brother for some photos and I’ve taken some myself.

On the photo: The ruined parts of the house now

On the photo: And the visualization of Susie’s future room that would be built there, from outside…

On the photo: and from inside.

On the photo: As Susie’s sister gets to sleep in her own room, Susie has been obsessed with the idea of sleeping in her own room, too. Soothing Susie to sleep in her little “room” - her tent - is a bit challenging, sometimes a bit funny also.I would like to thank everyone who spent a few minutes on reading my message. And I would also like to thank everyone who helps with either money or with a few kind words for the family. Encouraging, kind words always help.

Thank you!

Susie’s godmother

Susannah

story:
My Story

In September 2011 I was diagnosed with Adenocarcinoma (a form of non-small cell lung cancer). This type of cancer is mainly found in lifelong smokers, but has a small, puzzling rate of occurrence in young, female non-smokers. 

"The prognosis of nonâ€“small cell lung carcinoma (NSCLC) largely depends on tumor stage; indeed, the overall low survival rate (about 15% at 5 years) is primarily due to the high frequency of late diagnosis, when the tumor has become unresectable. Conversely, early-stage NSCLC patients (stage Iâ€“II) have a significantly better prognosis (30%â€“60% survival at 5 years)."


Fortunately I was diagnosed in Stage I, and treated in Stage I and II through two surgeries: a Video-Assisted Thoracic Surgery (VATS) on October 28, 2011 and a wedge resection on December 21, 2011. The latter was a thoracotomy, which involved breaking and spreading three lateral ribs to gain access to the necessary area. Based on the preliminary surgery results (the surgeon's evaluation and an initial CT scan), the prognosis is very good.  


I'm now recovering at home in the Chicago area with the physical and emotional assistance of many generous friends. I should be able to get around within a week and resume normal activities within a month. 


However, in order to pay $1,250 in medical bills, I've had to sacrifice the ability to visit my family or have my family visit me during these surgeries. As many of you know, I've also worked as much as I can tutoring and doing odd jobs around campus to pay these bills. I originally asked for an iPad for Christmas on this site, but... 


***Update: Due to the immense generosity of the first two anonymous donors, the initial goal (getting me an iPad) has been met. 50% of all future donations will go to my medical bill savings and 50% to one of the following two charities. Please let me know your charity preference in your message whether you choose to donate publicly or anonymously. (Or you can email me your preference later). 


(1) National Lung Cancer Partnership (4-star on Charity Navigator): 

http://www.nationallungcancerpartnership.org/

National Lung Cancer Partnership is dedicated to decreasing deaths due to lung cancer, and helping patients live longer and better, through research, awareness and advocacy. Founded in 2001 as Women Against Lung Cancer, the organization changed its name to National Lung Cancer Partnership in 2006 to better reflect the partnership we have forged with physicians, researchers, lung cancer survivors and their families, advocacy organizations and the media to help achieve our mission. We are ultimately working to advance lung cancer treatments for all patients. We achieve our goal by funding research to increase our understanding of how lung cancer starts and progresses, and how better to detect and treat it.


(2) PAWS Chicago (4-star on Charity Navigator): 

http://www.pawschicago.org/

PAWS Chicago is the city's largest no kill humane organization, focused on implementing solutions to end the killing of homeless pets. Since PAWS Chicago's founding in 1997, the number of homeless dogs and cats killed annually has dropped more than 50 percent: from more than 42,000 homeless pets killed in 1997 to under 20,000 killed in 2006. PAWS Chicago is working to build a no kill Chicago - a city where pets are no longer destroyed just because they are homeless. PAWS Chicago will find new homes for more than 3,000 homeless pets this year with the brand new state-of-the-art Lincoln Park Adoption & Humane Center. The PAWS Chicago Lurie Spay/Neuter Clinic, the largest free spay/neuter clinic in Chicago and the nation, will sterilize more than 14,000 pets of low-income families this year.


***

Campaign Purpose

I have not been able to travel to visit family or have family visit me. I have not been able to purchase anything for Christmas with funds that have been given to me. While some new dressier, clothes would be most practical, all I want is an iPad 2. I do not need an iPad 2; I just want one really bad. It's a completely self-indulgent request, but if I am only going to get one Christmas present, this is what I want.


What I Need & What You Get

I need $570, of which I can provide approximately $50. The cost breakdown:


  • $500 iPad 2
  • $39 smart cover
  • $33 tax

You get the satisfaction of knowing you made one 28-year old girl really happy.

story:
Our Story

My name is Rhea and I have become the round the clock caregiver for my loving husband Chris, who was diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease. After a series of unsuccessful operations, his condition worsened and brought on a whole new set of debilitating health problems that have changed both of our lives forever. 


Until recently we had been receiving some governmental aid, however we have now been denied coverage despite Chris' team of doctors and neurosurgeons letters of appeal:


 "It has recently come to my attention that my patient, Chris Cowing is being denied in home care services for his daily living functions. Please note, due to patients advanced Parkinson's Disease, he is unable to care for himself or verbally communicate aside from smiling, limited facial expression and limited gestures.... This patient has a unilateral deep brain stimulator in place and has difficulty with ambulation and does fall at times. He needs 24-hour care and surveillance, which his wife is currently providing for him.... It would be inhumane to deny someone in this condition these much needed services and assistance. "


Despite the doctors pleas to help us, we are still not receiving any assistance. I have transcribed some of what my husband Chris wishes to communicate to you:


"I am trapped in my body. Unfortunately I can no longer work. However I still think very clearly and I am thankful I have this life and a wonderful woman by my side to take care of me. It is very hard for me to ask for help as I have always been a very proud person. I now need full time help which my dear wife Rhea is happily willing to give, but we have absolutely no source of income. Please give whatever you can and know that the thought of giving gives abundant receiving." 


Other Ways You Can Help

Of course not everyone is in a position to contribute financially, but we would be grateful for any stories from people who might have gone through similar circumstances or who might suggest other resources we could learn about during this tumultuous time.  


Thank You!

story:
Relax & Have some FUN!

We invite you to create your own moves!

 

 

About our Timeline:

The toolings are ready and on standby for the mass production.  Our goal is to deliver the first mass-produced Officiser as soon as possible after testing the product.

 

Our Team

We are a team of passion, commitment, professionalism, perseverance and positive spirit with the mission to bring our lifestyle into a more healthy and enjoyable one.

Share Now with your friends!

              

 

 

 

FAQ

 

1. Q: How does the "smart compatible" feature work?

A: We have tested with Shaomi's MI band (MI band has to be placed the screen side down).  We will keep testing with other wearables, but here are some tips for compatibility qualifications:
  a. Your wearable should fit inside the pedal pocket-space:
       5.5 cm x 5.5cm x 1.1 cm (2.16" x 2.16" x 0.43")
  b. Your wearable should detect movement without being in direct contact with your skin
  c. Your wearable should detect movement within the movement range of 28cm (11")

 

2. Q: How much weight does it support?

A; The weight resistance is up to 40 kg / 88 lb (with or without board).  This means that your leg resting on Officiser should not exceed 40kg.  Considering the body weight % that is put on our legs/feet while sitting - 20%, user up to 200kg / 440lb can use Officiser.
When standing -as long as you are not leaning against the footrest(which you shouldn't be doing)- but just resting your one leg on Officiser while having the main weight on the other leg on the floor, the weight dispersion is around the same; less than 20%. (So up to 200kg / 440 lb user can use Officiser)

3. Q: What is the noise level? What does lower than 20dB mean?

A; We have tested with the sound meter in a quiet office (but the sound meter being sensitive, still showed around 35+ dB). When officising, the additional dB that was generated as noise was less than 20dB (the total level did not go beyond 50dB).
Here is an indicator of the noise levels for you reference, and a video link where you can actually hear the raw sound.

(Noise measuring video)


Noise level indicator:


4. Q: How does the DIY tension work

A: You can add tension to your routine by putting any market available elastic band at the designed spot under the device.  However, please note that we recommend to use without tension since officising is designed to use throughout the day.  Repetitive tension exercise for prolonged time is likely to generate stress and tension on your muscles, and this is the reason we recommend to use without any resistance.  At first it's going to feel too easy... but trust us, using throughout the day, you will feel it working on your muscles and burn off some of those additional calories.

story:
Spring 2014: 1600-mile bike tour to provide yoga to unconventional/underserved spaces along the East Coast. Documentary to follow.

  ProjectSPACE 

transforming "unconventional" spaces into yoga studios
--mindfulness to the streets--

Spring 2014
Philadelphia, PA to Miami, FL
~1600 miles
~45 days
via Bicycle!

ProjectSPACE works to assist individuals struggling with trauma, abuse, addiction, homelessness and poverty, through the practice of yoga and self-care principles. 

ProjectSPACE is dedicated to: 
-bringing yoga and mindfulness to “unconventional” spaces and under-served and under-resourced communities 
-transforming various environments into safe spaces for practice
-bridging the gap of disconnectedness between what we know about ourselves
-helping students find a connection to the untapped potential that exists within them; greater ease in the body, greater clarity in the mind!    

What is Yoga? What does it mean to be underserved? What is unconventional?    
-Doing anything with an attention to how you feel is Yoga
-“Underserved” usually means not served; resources and a community of support are lacking 
-“Unconventional” is only a misconception; yoga can be done anywhere, by anyone. *This project will not be using mats for this reason 

  •  On this tour, I will work to provide drop-in yoga programs to facilities along the East Coast. The drop-in program will be a one-day initiation into the practice of yoga, with a 1-hour long class of asana, pranayama and meditation. While focusing on different exercises and practices for anxiety, stress reduction, PTSD, and overall well being, we will learn simple and safe methods of activating PSNS for calming and grounding. 

Cities of interest:  
-Philadelphia, PA
-Wilmington, DE
-Baltimore, MD
-Washington, D.C.
-Fredericksburg, VA
-Richmond, VA
-Raleigh, NC
-Fayetteville, NC
-Columbia, SC
-Augusta, GA
-Atlanta, GA
-Jacksonville, FL
-Daytona Beach, FL
-Fort Pierce, FL
-Miami, FL 

Facilities of interest:
-schools
-youth and family shelters
-rehabilitation facilities
-domestic violence centers
-juvenile delinquent centers
-social service centers

WHY is this important?
-yoga is an everyday survival skill!
-it is important to learn how to appropriately deal with and regulate our emotions
-our whole lives we are taught how to look at and verify things in the external world; we are never properly taught how to look at and verify within
-students will leave the class with solid, practical tools to integrate into their lives, promoting self-healing, awareness, and connection to themselves and others
-our youth are often being dismissed and are not provided with the proper resources to cope/deal
        -if they don’t learn the way we teach them, teach them the way they  learn!

Where will all of the donations go to?
All donations will strictly be used for the materials and means to make the bike tour and documentary possible. Here is a list of all materials:
-Fuji touring bicycle
-bike seat
-panniers
-bike pedals
-cycling jersey
-spare inner tubes
-bike gloves
-bike helmet
-riding shoes
-riding shorts
-patch kit
-headlight
-multitool
-bike pump
-tablet
-Adventure Maps
-GoPro camera
-lodging/food while on tour
-all projectSPACE promo materials

During the bike tour, I will be filming the trip (the journey, the classes, the interactions, the communities, etc) and compiling a documentary of ProjectSPACE's exploration of different spaces as safe spaces for practice.

I need your help to allow this project to come to fruition! Any donation helps! Spread the word!

*Any additional questions? Please feel free to contact me by email or read for further FAQ's to see exactly what projectSPACE is intending to do with all funds and why I chose the materials listed above

*Design by Angela Miles of Carpe Diem Construction Company (C/D/C/Co)
http://carpediemconstruction.com/

*Photography and video by Abigail Reimold
http://abireimoldphoto.com

*Music by Spirit and Dust
http://spiritanddust.bandcamp.com
story_txt:
Spring 2014: 1600-mile bike tour to provide yoga to 
unconventional/underserved spaces along the East Coast. Documentary to 
follow. 
ProjectSPACE 

transforming "unconventional" spaces into yoga studios --mindfulness to the streets--Spring 2014
Philadelphia, PA to Miami, FL
~1600 miles
~45 days
via Bicycle!ProjectSPACE
 works to assist individuals struggling with trauma, abuse, addiction, 
homelessness and poverty, through the practice of yoga and self-care 
principles. ProjectSPACE is dedicated to: -bringing yoga and mindfulness to “unconventional” spaces and under-served and under-resourced communities -transforming various environments into safe spaces for practice-bridging the gap of disconnectedness between what we know about ourselves-helping
 students find a connection to the untapped potential that exists within
 them; greater ease in the body, greater clarity in the mind!     What is Yoga? What does it mean to be underserved? What is unconventional?     -Doing anything with an attention to how you feel is Yoga-“Underserved” usually means not served; resources and a community of support are lacking -“Unconventional” is only a misconception; yoga can be done anywhere, by anyone. 
*This project will not be using mats for this reason 
 On this tour, I will work to provide drop-in yoga programs to 
facilities along the East Coast. The drop-in program will be a one-day 
initiation into the practice of yoga, with a 1-hour long class of asana,
 pranayama and meditation. While focusing on different exercises and 
practices for anxiety, stress reduction, PTSD, and overall well being, 
we will learn simple and safe methods of activating PSNS for calming and
 grounding. Cities of interest:
 -Philadelphia, PA
-Wilmington, DE
-Baltimore, MD
-Washington, D.C.
-Fredericksburg, VA
-Richmond, VA
-Raleigh, NC
-Fayetteville, NC
-Columbia, SC
-Augusta, GA
-Atlanta, GA
-Jacksonville, FL
-Daytona Beach, FL
-Fort Pierce, FL
-Miami, FL Facilities of interest:-schools-youth and family shelters-rehabilitation facilities-domestic violence centers-juvenile delinquent centers-social service centersWHY is this important?-yoga is an everyday survival skill!-it is important to learn how to appropriately deal with and regulate our emotions-our
 whole lives we are taught how to look at and verify things in the 
external world; we are never properly taught how to look at and verify 
within
-students will leave the class with solid, practical tools to 
integrate into their lives, promoting self-healing, awareness, and 
connection to themselves and others
-our youth are often being dismissed and are not provided with the proper resources to cope/deal
        -if they don’t learn the way we teach them, teach them the way they  learn!

story:
Remember the last headache you had.  Or the last joint pain.  What did you take to help with the pain?  Maybe Tylenol or Ibuprofen.  Imagine not having access to something as basic as over the counter pain relievers.  Everyday pain is of course innevitable, but what a blessing it is that we have access to simple medications to treat pain.  I would like to share that access with the people living in small, rural villages of Uganda.  In January, I will be going on a medical trip to Tororo, Uganda and traveling to a few  villages in the area to provide  medical care to those in need.  Our group will be bringing basic medical supplies including over the counter pain relievers to hand out to villagers. This fundraising campaign will help me raise money to buy these medications as well as other basic medical supplies. 

 

Thank you for your support and donation!

 

Erin

story:
Kris Burke has been battling breast cancer since 2001, and the cancer has now metastacized to other parts of her body. Last year she lost her job as a teacher, and with it, her affordable health insurance. Kris and her husband Ben have tried to keep life normal for their daughter Skyler, a kindergartener at our school, but their financial situation has been tough and at one time their house was close to foreclosure. Members of our community have held several fundraisers to help the Burkes with their medical and household expenses, but now we face a new challenge.

Kris' doctor recently told her that the chemotherapy was no longer controlling the tumors on her liver, so she is now using holistic naturopathic treatments, many of which are not covered by health insurance.  Our current project is to make some repairs on their house, including a new roof, so their family can have a safe, comfortable home in which to savor their family time.  We're raising money to pay for the building materials, and most of the work will be done by volunteers. 

A donation of any amount is greatly appreciated.  We'd also be very grateful if you would share Kris' story via social media, email, or any method you can think of.  There is much more information on www.KeepingKrisStrong.org including several articles that have appeared in the local media.
 
We have a work day planned for May 18th, so we are hoping to raise the funds to pay for all of our building materials as soon as possible.
 
Thank you for considering our cause!!

story:
As many of you know, I am in the "middle" of a transition.  A pretty major actually.  I'm like a butterfly that is emerging from her cocoon.  For 35 years I was one thing, and now I am emerging as something , no Someone, different. Beautiful, and a whole life to live.

 

Throughout my transition, there are challenges.  Major and minor ones, just like any change one would go through. Most of those changes are simply a matter of time and being on the right mix and amount of prescription medication and hormone therapy. Change is slow but sure.

 

I have noticed that there are two changes in which no matter how much time passes, it will not change without, outside interference.

 

The first is my facial hair. This simply will not go away by waiting for time to expire. This is not a huge issue as I do not seem to have a heavy beard or 'stache. I do have a 5 o'clock shadow that is noticeable. I do have esthetician, that is willing to do the work on my hair for 150-175 per session and it should only take about 6 sessions, so that is $1050.

 

One of the hardest things in my transition from my former life to my new existence, is my voice. I consistently get confused as a guy.  I don't look like a guy, I don't dress or act like a guy, but my voice is that of an Alto singer guy, from what my spouse says. No matter what the range of my voice is, I am referred to as "sir", "he", "him". Even by those I work with closely. This is not a matter of sounding like a boy on the phone, it's about sounding like a boy in all aspects of my existence. I am scheduled to start talks with a voice therapist on the 16th of October to start voice training for MtF TG voice issues.

 

For a person in my condition, these two things are the most troublesome of things to overcome.  Many of you have known me for a good deal of time now and some of you have just met me.

 

I am not asking for pity, I am not asking for charity, I am not asking for a hand-out. I fully expect and I am fully prepared to "pay" for the help which is given.

 

I have my own business making paracord survival bracelets, collars, leashes, belts and key fobs. For your help and donation, I will give you the equivalent of your donation, in my product. This means that if you donate $10 to helping me achieve these two goals, then I will give you $10 worth of product. This can be any items from my site, so long as the total matches your donation. Rules will apply here.  1) do NOT order from the site. At this time I do not have the means to put coupon codes into my website to allow for this. If you donate and choose to accept product in return, then please email me. We will conduct business through email. 2) You do have the option of refusing product in exchange for product or asking that product be donated to an individual or organization. 3) Please remember that because this is a business I can't give product away for an unlimited amount. I do have to limit this to $50.

 

If you have questions or concerns or even idea please feel free to share. I would also like to assure everyone that helps, that this money will ONLY go towards the causes that I have listed here. If there is more donations than are needed, the remainder will be donated to a foster care charity.

story:
The Skinny:

The Rock Torch web site has published music recommendations from musicians like Sean Lennon, Kate Nash and Mike Doughty since 2010.

Now, we are taking the best posts from the site and turning it into a book. 

All profits from the book will be going to the following charities:
  • The Sweet Relief Fund, which provides financial assistance to musicians that are facing illness, disability, or age-related problems.
  • Local food banks in great music cities across the U.S.
  • To help the victims of Hurricane Sandy

So many artists have contributed their words to this project.  Now, with your help, we can give something back to musicians in need, the cities that they are from, and those who need our help most right now.  Please donate!

Why We Need Your Help:

We need your financial support to pay the illustrators, design team and copy editors for the project.  We also will use funds that are raised to market the book across the Web and in print advertisements. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We know that money is tight.  If you can't swing a contribution, you can still help by spreading the word about this campaign! 
 
Please use the sharing tools here on IndieGoGo to post your Facebook page, Tweet about it, blog it....whatever you can do is appreciated! The share link is http://indiegogo.com/rocktorch for all you 'copy/paste' fans out there. Thanks for your support!

story:
Andrew Hegt, 35, of Morganville, passed away suddenly and unexpectedly Thursday, June 14.

Born in Brooklyn, NY, Andrew had grown up in Marlboro before moving to Freehold and then to Morganville 5 years ago. He was a partner at the law firm of LaRocca, Hornik, Rosen, Greenberg, & Blaha PC, Freehold, NJ.

Andrew was an amazing husband to his wife, an incredible, devoted father to his children, a wonderful son to his mother, an incredible brother, and a loyal friend to all he knew. Andrew had a tremendous sense of humor, and a quick wit that was unmatched. He was completely devoted to his family and friends, and was always the person to call when you needed anything. He was one of those people that if you met him once, you would remember him forever.

He adored his wife and children more than anything in the world. An avid fan of both the NY Yankees and New York Giants, he grew up an athlete, eventually becoming a star soccer player in high school. He went on to play soccer for, and graduate from Monmouth University. He then graduated from New York Law School and went on to become a very well respected attorney. He was named a partner at his law firm early this year. He will be deeply missed by his children, wife, family, friends, and all who knew him.

He was predeceased by his father, Jay Hegt, in 2000. Surviving are his loving wife, Deidre Hegt, his son Jayden; his newborn twins, son Alexander, and daughter Kendall; his mother Rhoda Hegt of Marlboro; and his brother and sister-in-law Matthew and Tara Hegt and their daughter Jana, of Manalapan; his mother-in-law and father -in-law Patricia and Joseph Kelich of Manalapan; his brother-in-law and his fiancée Jason Lisi and Diana Anastasio of Staten Island, NY.

Donations can be made to the Hegt Memorial Fund, care of LaRocca, Hornik, Rosen, Greenberg, & Blaha, Freehold Commons, 83 South Street, 3rd Floor, Freehold, NJ 07728.

story:
My good friend Becca was diagnosed with breast cancer this year.  She is an amazing woman and I can't believe that she has to go through this!

Last month Becca had surgey to remove both breasts and lymph nodes.  She has to now go through 1 year of chemo and other therapies to try and get at this aggressive form of cancer. Through all this Becca has not complained, has not asked for anything, and has been there for others to help them cope with her cancer. She is amazing with her words.. and her definitions.. and her positive outlook...  .... she IS amazing! 

This is something you just don't think of ... Becca is a young woman!  She has a husband,  two kids, two dogs, 2 guinea pigs who love her so much.Becca's husband has been through so much, he has had to work full time, and now take care of both girls, do all the errands, clean the house, and take full care of Becca while she recovers from such an extensive surgery.  

Becca works for as a family resourse coordinator and seriously LOVES helping other families all the time!  During all this Becca has been off work. Between her being off work and her husband taking days off things are tight.  

I went over to visit, see how Becca was.  Her father was on the way to see her, and her husband was out in the yard fixing something for the kids.  Becca said to me "I wish he had some help cleaning the house, he's doing such a good job keeping up on everything but he's just so exausted, and now I wish I could run the vacuum before my dad comes over without having to bother anyone" ... you see Becca was on the couch, propped up, recovering from intensive surgery .. and still thinking about not bothering anyone.  We  I ran the vacuum, but havn't got that image out of my head.

I am hoping to raise enough money that I can at least help hire a cleaning person to go in there and clean her home once a week for the year that Becca has to go through Chemo. If we can get more than that at least the family won't be in danger of financial hurt along with everything else they are already going through.

I wish I was better with words so that I could explain how much this would mean for her family.  We are thankful for everything that comes in no matter how much. 

Please help me help Becca and her family!

 

For video pictures go to   ..  

http://animoto.com/play/XRrrhArAcOFCGVIRJ1t3Aw

 

Read her amazing blog at  ..

http://www.caringbridge.org/visit/rebeccawedgewood

......just make a login and view journal history!

story:
WIRELESS 

DreamPhones are headphones comfortable for side sleepers, back sleepers, front sleepers and if you’re travelling or jogging.

Bluetooth® enabled headphones sync/stream from any Bluetooth® 3.0 device. 

The best feature of these DreamPhones is  that they are wireless.  Simply sync up the Wireless DreamPhones and you can listen freely for up to 30 feet away from your sound source. No ear buds or clunky ear enclosures. Incredible comfort.

Like to listen to music in bed? DreamPhones are the most comfortable headphones to wear to sleep all night long. 

Wireless DreamPhones provide good quality sound that makes them great for more than just sleeping. You can wear DreamPhones while relaxing or jogging  without having to adjust your headphones if you need to get up and move around. No matter what you listen to or how much you roll over in your sleep, you will never get tangled up in wires.


DreamPhones are the thinnest headphones in the world.  Dreamphones reduces ambient noise, conversations, traffic sounds, and even snoring.






Slim stereo speakers hidden inside a headband are made to create a comfortable audio system.  Dreamphones headphones are ultra-thin and ultra-soft. 


                    

           



                                                           AVAILABLE COLORS




We’re totally confident that this project will be completed. Although we are a small team, we use professional manufacturing resources and we assure you that we will do our utmost to ensure you receive your product within 4-6 weeks after our campaign ends. 

With your support, we can then start large scale manufacturing and get DreamPhones to stores worldwide, and you can be proud to know that you made it happen. Your contribution is not necessary with money and if you do not have the money right now, there are many other ways to contribute and to help us. You can share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family. It is fast and easy as you just have to click on any of the Facebook, Twitter, and other sharing buttons. Thanks for your interest and consideration!


       


-Give the gift of better sleep this holiday season with DreamPhones-

will do our utmost to ensure you receive your product within 4-6 weeks after
our campaign ends. With your support, we
can then start large scale manufacturing and get DreamPhones to stores
worldwide, and you can be proud to know that you made it happen. Your
contribution is not necessary with money and if you do not have the money right
now, there are many other ways to contribute and to help us. You can share our
Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family. It is fast and easy as you
just have to click on any of the Facebook, Twitter, and other sharing
buttons. Thanks for your
interest and consideration!

       -Give the gift of better sleep this holiday
season with DreamPhones-

story:
ESPAÑOL

Para información en español sobre VITA FX, visita la entrevista de nuestros fundadores!: Entrevista en diario el sur.

Además, visita nuestro sitio web: VITA FX

Únete a la comunidad VITA FX aquí: Red VITA FX para pacientes y profesionales de la salud

ENGLISH

Join the VITA FX network here: For patients and Health Professional, its free!

Visit our Website: VITA FX


Be part of the change …  

WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS OF 

VITA FX?


ESPAÑOL

Para información en español sobre VITA FX, visita la entrevista de nuestros fundadores!: Entrevista en diario el sur.

Además, visita nuestro sitio web: VITA FX

Únete a la comunidad VITA FX aquí: Red VITA FX para pacientes y profesionales de la salud

ENGLISH

Join the VITA FX network here: For patients and Health Professional, its free!
Visit our Website: VITA FX




OUR VISION, OUR DREAMS

The concept of Interoperability refers to the capacity that some systems have to connect to be able to share users information and make it visible from any healthcare center. This is an important discussion around the world: Who owns health records? We think it belongs to people and our technology can protect it. At the same time, we can allow healthcare professionals to use it when needed. WE WILL NEVER SELL PATIENTS’ HEALTH DATA.



THE PROBLEM.


OUR SOLUTION.



WHY DO WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT?.

 WE CAN DO THE FOLLOWING: 



ESPAÑOL

Para información en español sobre VITA FX, visita la entrevista de nuestros fundadores!: Entrevista en diario el sur.

Además, visita nuestro sitio web: VITA FX

Únete a la comunidad VITA FX aquí: Red VITA FX para pacientes y profesionales de la salud

ENGLISH

Join the VITA FX network here: For patients and Health Professional, its free!

Visit our Website: VITA FX

PERKS.


OUR TEAM. 


At the moment, we’ve developed the first version of VITA FX, which was presented at the Future Health Now Conference, organized by us.


Juan Arellano, Jack Andraka and Jose Arellano, Future Health Now, Santiago de Chile, 2016


We created FHN to transform the healthcare environment both in Chile and Latin America so that innovation can reach to people who need it the most: the patients.


This is the perfect moment to transform the healthcare environment and you can be part of it, help us to revolutionize the healthcare experience.


FAQ:

Who did your movie?

Rodrigo Contreras, Film director, editor and creative mind: www.rodmanmcfly.com made our short video, and we recommend him to anyone in a heartbeat! He is amazing!!

Thanks for all your support, time and experience, without you we couldn’t have launched this campaign.


Is VITA-FX hiring?

We are always on the lookout for talented people to join our team. If you think your background and goals are aligned with ours please send an email to jose.arellano@vita-fx.org

If I have questions, how can I reach your team?

Please read through the FAQ first because your answer might be there. We are receiving a lot of special requests, and we are replying A.S.A.P.! 
For questions related to the Indiegogo campaign, you can contact support@indiegogo.com. 
if you have any other enquiries regarding vita fx, contact us at hola@vita-fx.org


What can VITA FX do for me?.

VITA FX will bring you the possibility to get in touch with your healthcare professionals,  share exams,  meet other people like you,etc.. We want to create one of the biggest communities for healthcare and support in the world.


How does VITA FX make this possible?

VITA FX  has different functionalities for healthcare professionals, which are at the center of the patient’s experience improvement. For example, with VITA FX, healthcare professionals can create workgroups to analize specific cases [ONLY WITH the PATIENT’S APPROVAL]. This will improve patient care by optimizing the information flow. It’s simple and easy. You will never again wait forlong to receive your physician’s opinion about  your exams. It’s easy!


How does VITA FX make sure that my interaction with health care professionals work?

We believe that the owners of the information are patients themselves, thus VITA FX is not a healthcare provider web based service.  VITA FX is a tool for you to take ownership of your own information. Each patient and healthcare professional have their own responsibility in terms of how they use the VITA FX network, and how they commit to their patients. That’s why we are an open and flexible health network. Everyone is invited!


¿Who can see my clinical data [PHR]?

No one, unless you give someone access. Your data is only shared with the people you give permission.. If you don´t give permission to others, the only one who can see your data is you. Please, don’t share your data with profiles/people that you don’t know in real life.


I have tried to connect with my healthcare professionals but haven’t been able to do so, is this part of VITA FX service?

VITA FX is not responsible for the use that healthcare professionals give to the VITA FX network. The VITA FX project supports a more closed relationship between healthcare professionals and patients. But,we are not a healthcare provider.

Is this network only for Physicians?

At VITA FX we believe in a people-centered healthcare. Because of that, we are an open and flexible system that wants to integrate in the same network everyone working for patients health including Psychologists, Nurses, etc., others. The main thing is to improve communication among them.  

Could i invite complementary medicine practitioners or other types of medicine (E.g.: acupuncture)?

Of course. Everyone is invited. However, We want to protect our users from problems. Therefore, we will differentiate between healthcare professionals with credentials from healthcare institutions and those who don’t have them. We only recommend you to be in touch with people/profiles that you know in real life.

story:
Short Summary

               Hello everyone! My name is Samran ( which means HAPPY in Thai language). I am the creator of  Owie unique emergency medical box. The idea of Owie medical box comes from both my outdoor activities and nursing experiences.

              I worked as a triage nurse, community health nurse, and education nurse more than 20 years. I like outdoor activities such as cruising, camping, fishing, and hiking…… etc. I believe many of us enjoy traveling as much as I do. I know we all do not want to get sick during the vacation. However, unexpected health problems and injuries could happen  anytime and anywhere such as finger cut, stomach pain, diarrhea, itchy rash, bug bite, tooth pain, headache, and back pain.

           Life threatening situation also can occur during vacation, such as dehydration and Hypoglycemia. Imagine you have diabetic person in the car who need to eat or drink  immediately to increase  his or her blood sugar. However, you are driving in an unfamiliar and remote area, you don't know where to go and when you can find food or drinks. Every minute is counted; money is not matter at this moment,  Glucose tablets in your emergency box could be life-saving in this circumstance. 

           Owie box is a unique and compact medical box contain several vital medications and medical supplies such as Tylenol, Ibuprofen, burn cream, anti-itch cream, allergy medication, single use thermometer and glucose tablet. The Owie box is not only small enough to keep in the glove compartment  and the boat glove box, or carry on the trip but also efficient enough to reduce  the severity of many unpredictable  health consequences until further assessment by a medical providers.

         Unique features of Owie box that make it different from other emergency medical sets  are

1.  Small, compact and lightweight medical kit that make it easy for users to see content inside the box and take it with them wherever they need.  The Owie Every Day Carry (EDC) box is measured 15cmsx20cmsx4cmsand weight only 12 ounces. The Owie Family Travel (FT) box is measured 20cmsx20cmsx4cms and weight 15.5 ounces.

2. Owie box obtains several products that are not, usually, found in other medical kits such as single use thermometer, glucose tablet, oral pain relief.

3. Owie box comes with instruction sheet that provide useful and important information related to the medication in the box such as indication, dosage, and warning, therefore,  users know what medication to take, when to take it and how to take it.

           The simplicity, efficiency and practicality are the main concepts  of the Owie box. Multiple factors and various health problems in different situations are considered before finalizing the content of the box. 

       Owie box has four versions which are

1. Owie EDC (Every Day Carry) box which contains 67 items as shown below

  •  5 packages of Tylenol, Ibuprofen, Diphenhydramine, Bismuth subsalicylate (treat heartburn, upset stomach, nausea, diarrhea), Small latex free bandage, Alcohol swab, Triple antibiotic, Sterile cotton tip and 4 packs of single use thermometer
  • 5 packages of Anti-itch, Burn cream,  Oral pain relief (for tooth pain, gum pain, Canker sore), Large latex free bandage.
  • 1 pack of  glucose tablet (10 tablets), Latex free self-adhesive elastic wrap (2 inches), and tweezers

2. Owie FT (Family Travel)  box contains 88 items which are

  • 5 packages of Tylenol, Ibuprofen, Diphenhydramine, Bismuth subsalicylate (treat heartburn, upset stomach, nausea, diarrhea), Motion sickness relief, Electrolyte tablets, Small latex free bandage, Alcohol swab, Triple antibiotic, Sterile cotton tip, 2x2 sterile gauze pad and 4 packs of Single use thermometer.
  •  5 packages of Anti-itch, Burn cream, Insect sting relief pad, Oral pain relief (for tooth pain, gum pain, Canker sore), Large latex free bandage.
  • 1 pack of  glucose tablet (10 tablets), Latex free self-adhesive elastic wrap (2 inches), ACE bandage (2 inches), and one tweezers

        3. Refill set for Owie EDC box (68 items) with instruction sheet

        4. Refill set for Owie FT box (89 items)  with instruction sheet

             Each box and refill set come with an instruction sheet that provide useful and important information about the medical products in the box such as name of the medications, indication, dosage, side effect, and warning.

              The contributor will help not only funding the Owie emergency medical box project but also raising awareness of preparation for unpredicted health problems.

               

        What We Need & What You Get

               The Owie emergency medical box is in the process of production. The funding will help  to produce a large quantity of this product and delivery to needed families. 

             The donor will  have the opportunities not only to own Owie unique medical boxes in the special price before others but also to make Residential medical box project proceed and accomplish

        1. For the contribution of $35 you will receive one of Owie EDC box
        2. Each donor of $40 will receive an Owie FT box
        3. Each donor of $65 will receive an Owie EDC box with refill set
        4. Each donor of $75 will receive an Owie FT box with refill set 
        (Each additional refill set for EDC box is $30 and $35 for FT box)
                The shipping is free for US address. Outside US, please contact me for the quoting of the shipping cost at owiemedbox@gmail.com. If the funding does not reach the goal, the donors still receive the Owie box before the end of November, 2014; however, the project of Residential Owie medical box will be delayed and possibly cancelled. The contribution less than $39 will be saved for the funding of Residential Owie medical box which is a bigger and advanced version of Owie  box. The residential box is in preliminary  production process of choosing the proper content in the box for the best use in various health issues.
                 This Residential box will be distributed without charge to the homeless shelter, church, and household in a remote location.  Supporters also can donate money toward Owie Residential box project directly as little as $1. The donor of this project will receive an update of donation money , final version of Owie residential box, the number of residential boxes  distributed, and the list of receivers periodically.

            The Impact

                  The Owie medical box campaign is not only about selling, marketing for Owie medical box  but also giving something back to the community.  I believe no one should be left alone without medical help. Owie Residential medical box is filled with the medication, medical supplies for everyday health problems. However, all Owie  medical boxes  do not intend to replace medical care, but instead provide the basic necessary medical help such as reducing pain, burning, itching,  bleeding before further evaluation from professional medical provider.

                 Moreover, The Residential Owie medical box will be a great resource for basic treatment for people who have delay access or no access to medical care.

            Let's Do something GOOD! together 

              Risks & Challenges

                      The challenges and risks of this project include

              1. Design the emergency medical box that is outstanding more than others in the markets.

              2. Making sure the contents in the medical box  are efficient and safe to use in many health situations.

              3. Promoting awareness and preparing community for unpredicted health problem.

                Other Ways You Can Help

                     Please feel free to tell your friend and family about Owie unique medical box project either by mouth or  through the media. I also open for the ideas of improvement. Please do not hesitate to send me the list of receivers that might benefit from Owie Residential box project.

                Let's go OWIE!

                Feel free to contact me anytime at owiemedbox@gmail.com

story:
Aus Deutschland? Hier klicken.

By now the campaign has received some media coverage, for instance at PETA's facebook page and on deutschland is(s)t vegan!

Have you taken a look at the outtakes from the video yet? You totally should.

Have you noticed the new perk "the warrior's trial"?

Idealistic ideas

The idea behind herbiwarrior is simple: to develop high-quality, vegan and allergy-friendly supplements, while making the whole process from production to shipment as eco-friendly and sustainable as possible. If you love sports and/or believe in conscious consumerism this is the campaign for you!

The first product, a delicious chocolate protein powder called ['veÊ¤], is ready to roll out and this campaign is to raise funding for the very first batch. A lot of time and effort have been put into this and now it kicks serious butt. Reactions from test groups have been enthusiastically positive and ['veÊ¤] is ready to be shared with as many people as possible.
The product:

  • 71% protein
  • purely plant-based
  • allergy-friendly*
  • all essential amino acids
  • packaging and labeling material from FSC-certified renewable resources
  • CO2-neutral shipment


*(The manufacturer gets payed extra to specially clean the machines before production and to do lab checks for gluten, soy, milk and egg residue afterwards)

For a detailed nutrient breakdown, click here.

Here's what other people (who were fortunate enough to procure a sample) have to say about it:

“Easy on the tastebuds and not as overly sweet as many other products out there. I’d like to have it as a post-workout drink regularly.”
- Philip D. (Martial arts instructor)
 
“It’s got everything I wish for: Creamy and delicious, plus it has 71% protein! I was actually a bit sad when my sample ran out.”
- Jonas P. (Postgrad student)
 
['veÊ¤] will sell for 27,99€ in retail, which is about 36$. One package will give you 540g (1.2lbs) of chocolaty goodness.
 

Financial fineprint

The manufacturer has a minimum order of 500kg. This is about 950 of the packs seen in the video. Below you can see a breakdown of the costs that the campaign goal is made up of.

Perky perks

the shirts
The limited edition shirts are made from organic cotton, have the company logo imprinted and will designate you as a contributer (pictures coming soon). The printjob is done in a facility here in Berlin that teaches juvenile delinquents useful skills (such as silk screen printing) to help them get back on track.

the ebook
The ebook will be specially made for contributers of this campaign. Within, I will compile some of my favorite hacks for working out and eating well plus strategies for motivation and behavioral change that I have gathered over the years and apply personally.

All material perks will be shipped via a service that offsets the emissions produced during shipment. Shipping costs are always included in the perk amounts.

If the goal is surpassed
Should the campaign raise more than the goal I would be able to invest into the company infrastructure such as the upcoming shop or possibly pay some money to the amazing people that have been providing their services for free so far. At twice the amount I would be able to also order the first batch of protein powder in vanilla. The development of that second flavor is already finished and it is waiting to be made.


Thank you for your support and please contact me for questions, comments and everything else!


If you can not contribute at this moment...don't worry, we're still cool. But if you would share this on facebook, tell a couple of your friends, family, peers, classmates or that one friend with the top 100 blog about it, you have my full and sincere thanks!


*NOTE: For all funders/backers, your payment WILL BE refunded if the goal is not reached.

Have you noticed the new perk "the warrior's trial"?

Idealistic ideas
The idea behind herbiwarrior is simple: to develop high-quality, vegan and allergy-friendly supplements, while making the whole process from production to shipment as eco-friendly and sustainable as possible. If you love sports and/or believe in conscious consumerism this is the campaign for you!The first product, a delicious chocolate protein powder called ['veÊ¤], is ready to roll out and this campaign is to raise funding for the very first batch. A lot of time and effort have been put into this and now it kicks serious butt. Reactions from test groups have been enthusiastically positive and ['veÊ¤] is ready to be shared with as many people as possible. The product:

71% protein
purely plant-based
allergy-friendly*
all essential amino acids
packaging and labeling material from FSC-certified renewable resources
CO2-neutral shipment
*(The manufacturer gets payed extra to specially clean the machines before production and to do lab checks for gluten, soy, milk and egg residue afterwards)For a detailed nutrient breakdown, click here.Here's what other people (who were fortunate enough to procure a sample) have to say about it:
“Easy on the tastebuds and not as overly sweet as many other products out there. I’d like to have it as a post-workout drink regularly.” - Philip D. (Martial arts instructor)
 
“It’s got everything I wish for: Creamy and delicious, plus it has 71% protein! I was actually a bit sad when my sample ran out.” - Jonas P. (Postgrad student)
 
['veÊ¤] will sell for 27,99€ in retail, which is about 36$. One package will give you 540g (1.2lbs) of chocolaty goodness.
 
Financial fineprint
The manufacturer has a minimum order of 500kg. This is about 950 of the packs seen in the video. Below you can see a breakdown of the costs that the campaign goal is made up of.

Perky perks
the shirtsThe limited edition shirts are made from organic cotton, have the company logo imprinted and will designate you as a contributer (pictures coming soon). The printjob is done in a facility here in Berlin that teaches juvenile delinquents useful skills (such as silk screen printing) to help them get back on track.the ebookThe ebook will be specially made for contributers of this campaign. Within, I will compile some of my favorite hacks for working out and eating well plus strategies for motivation and behavioral change that I have gathered over the years and apply personally.All material perks will be shipped via a service that offsets the emissions produced during shipment. Shipping costs are always included in the perk amounts.If the goal is surpassedShould the campaign raise more than the goal I would be able to invest into the company infrastructure such as the upcoming shop or possibly pay some money to the amazing people that have been providing their services for free so far. At twice the amount I would be able to also order the first batch of protein powder in vanilla. The development of that second flavor is already finished and it is waiting to be made.
Thank you for your support and please contact me for questions, comments and everything else!
If you can not contribute at this moment...don't worry, we're still cool. But if you would share this on facebook, tell a couple of your friends, family, peers, classmates or that one friend with the top 100 blog about it, you have my full and sincere thanks!
*NOTE: For all funders/backers, your payment WILL BE refunded if the goal is not reached.

story:
We have exceeded the amount we originally asked for and we thank everybody who as helped. Any extra donations will be used to help pay for the fees for the upcoming competition season. Those costs will probably come to another $1500. Your addtional donations will mean we won't have to do this in the fall! :)

(Check out the Gallery Tab for more pics and videos!)

Stephanie is a 12 year old competitive Freestyle Mogul Skier from a small town in Colorado, who needs to raise funds to go to Training Camp in Oregon this summer.

As an 11 year old this year she placed 3rd in the state USSA Rocky Mountain Division championships just missing first place by a few points in her age group of 11 and 12 year old girls.

Then she came in 9th place in the state open Rocky Mountain Division championships in dual course Mogul Freestyle while being the youngest competitor of a field of 37 including 17 and 18 year olds!

Going to training camp at Mt Hood Oregon would give her 2 weeks of invaluable instruction at the very difficult sport of Freestyle Mogul skiing. Competitors have to ski down a steep mogul course then make acrobatic jumps in the middle then land while keeping form and speed. 

Stephanie's coaches feel she has potential to be a world class freestyle mogul competitor—as long as she can afford her training.

Stephanie is a straight A student making Honor Roll every school quarter and is also an accomplished ballet dancer who pays for her lessons by helping teach younger girls. Unfortunately there is no such program available for her skiing.

And she's a sweetheart!

She has been raised by her single mom who works multiple jobs to make ends meet. Because of their economic situation, every dollar she earns has to be put into the essentials of their lives.

Stephanie dreams of skiing in the Olympics. Going to training camp this summer would be a big step to get her there.

Please help by contributing any amount you can!

Below is a description of the camp program by the Aspen Valley Ski & Snowboard Club Freestyle / Freeride Program Director: Eric Knight

The Aspen Valley Ski and Snowboard Club’s Freestyle Team is teaming up with Telluride Freestyle to produce a high level training camp from August 4 until the 12th.  We will train for approximately 8 days on snow with 2 rest days in between.  We will have a private mogul lane at Mt. Hood with some Jump set ups in and out of moguls.  By teaming up with Telluride we will have enough traffic to keep good moguls and have more coaches to build and maintain jump set ups and keep the camp cost affordable.  This has been a banner year for snow at Mt. Hood so August is assured to provide a good snow base for training.  Holding the camp in August allows athletes to bring their aerial maneuvers to snow after working all summer water ramping and tramping.  Camp cost will be approximately $1800 depending on the number of athletes participating.

story:
What a wonderful friend we have, But he is in trouble.

It's Double Chronic Pneumonia. He needs relief. Now!

To help, please send your contribution to our support fund and keep Seanny in your prayers!

In all seriousness, I wanted to do something nice for my good friend and would like to get him some extra cash to enjoy during his recovery. If you have any questions/concerns about the donations, please contact me on Facebook or email me: greg@gregoryjarvis.com.

Thank you all, Seanny will appreciate it!

-Greg Jarvis

story:
OUR GOAL IS $35,000 and above....

JD was just diagnosed with advanced breast cancer last week - she is going to need aggressive chemo and possibly up to two surgeries.  She already cannot work any more.

If you have ever met JD, she leaves a lasting impression on you. She is a fixture in our LGBT cinema culture having produced such instant classics as Eating Out 2, Shelter, A Marine Story and Elena Undone. 

You can see some of JD's work in our community in the video above, which was produced by the Los Angeles Gay & Lesbian Center in 2009 when JD received a LACE AWARD for her community service.

Throughout the years she has helped many of us with advice and guidance. There probably isn’t a single person in the community that hasn’t been affected by her whether they are aware of it or not.  Her passion for our film community helped countless others in their effort to create great cinema. 

 

I would have to say on a personal note that it was JD that gave me my first break in filmmaking. She hired me to shoot with her when I had little experience... I am grateful she took a chance. 

I am sure that many of you have your JD stories. 

JD, like many artists, is a freelancer with no health insurance.

We have been helping her get on financial aid to help cover the big medical expenses but it is going to be a very difficult and expensive road ahead regardless. Please consider helping JD as she will have many mounting medical costs and will be unable to work during this process. 

She plans to dedicate her time when she is well between surgeries and treatment to her favorite charities and to continue to mentor young lgbt film makers.  She wants to fill her healthy days with planning for the future and helping others, which is work she enjoys.  The positive nature of this will help get her through this big battle.

Now is the time for JD to concentrate on getting well. You can help take away the worry of costs by making a contribution now.

story:
I'll TRI anything for Women's World of Boxing!

As most of you know, I TRI. It's not my favorite thing to do, but I like that it keeps me active and headed toward a challenging goal. I've run races before benefitting causes I care for, but when starting to train for this race, I couldn't think of any other cause I care for more than getting a gym for Women's World of Boxing (WWB). 

Speaking of my favorite things to do, I started boxing in January 2012. The argument can be made that boxing changed my life. I won't go into it too much, but after 6 months of boxing, I am leaner, meaner, and a boxing machine-(r). I also met T (my coach) at that time, who has turned out to be one of the most inspirational and passionate women I've ever met. Because of the time and commitment T has put into me, T's mission is now mine as well -- to open a women's-only boxing gym to create an empowering place for women to box.

I'm raising money in hopes that I can help toward this dream. I'll be participating in the Cayuga Lake Triathlon in Ithaca, NY in August for WWB. I will be 1 of 384 kicking our own butts to swim, bike and run to the finish line.
 
Every dollar donated will go to WWB (apart from some fees taken from this website! I won't even tell you what happens if I don't reach my fundraising goal). Every dollar will help, too. We need a SPACE, heavy bags, speed bags, a ring, equipment, etc. We need it all. Boxing has changed my life, and I know it can change many more.
 

Take a moment to think about how I am sweating it out training for this crazy thing, possibly stop and chuckle at that, then PLEASE DONATE!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute or not, here are other ways you can help:

  • Please get the word out about Women's World of Boxing. Go to womensworldofboxing.com to see what they're all about. If you want to box, sign up! If you want to donate your services, contact them!
  • Please share this link with your friends! (Who may also be my friends that I missed)

story:
The Story of Us:

In October 2002 I married the love of my life.  I knew when I met John back in 1996 that I would be with him forever!  We’ve had a lot of happiness in our life – we have 2 beautiful nieces and a handsome nephew and I have an adorable Godson.  We have a wonderful family and awesome friends that are just like family.  But in our life we’ve also had to deal with two great losses… I lost my Mom in 1997 and John lost his Dad in 2001.  But we’ve always come thru the hard times with the help of each other.  We’ve always wanted a big family and now we’re coming up to our 10 year anniversary and we’re still missing the one thing we wanted most – kids.  It’s been a very emotional and heart-breaking experience for us.

We started trying to have kids in 2006.  And thought it would be an easy task.  You just want kids and you have them.  Well, that wasn’t the case for us.  We thought we just weren’t timing it right or it would happen soon enough, but 6 years later - it hasn’t.

 I talked to my OB/GYN about it and he referred me to a Fertility doctor.  She told us we were the 1% of the population that had unexplained infertility.  So we decided to first try Clomid.  After 6 cycles -  nothing happened.  It was so hard to wait every month and then be disappointed when we weren’t pregnant.   After taking a few months break, the doctor then recommended we try the next step and go with the injectible fertility treatments of Follistim and Ovidrel with an IUI (Intrauterine insemination).  We were excited to try this next step.  Then we found out it wasn’t covered by our insurance.  We didn’t care - $1400 later we tried it for the first time.  And it didn’t work.  Two more times and nothing.  After our third try I needed a break.  It was emotionally and physically exhausting.  Having a baby was something we thought about every day –waiting and waiting to see if THIS time was going to be the time. 

This spring we decided to try a new doctor.  Dr. Bruce Rose of Infertility Solutions.  We heard awesome things about him.  We went and it was so exciting.  He is so positive.  After some tests on John and a hysteroscopy on me it was time for the bad news.  The doctor said with the issues we both have (John’s sperm aren’t strong enough to penetrate the egg & I have a layer of tissue covering my ovaries making it impossible for sperm to get thru) we will NEVER have children naturally – it just won’t work.  Our only option was to have IVF.  After that news sank in – we knew what we needed to do.

So here we are today.  We’ve decided that’s if this is the path we were meant to take then it’s the path we’re going to take.  And we can really use your help to bring our first baby into this world.

Where the money will go:

We’re opting to have Multi-Cycle conventional IVF (3 for 2) package.  If the first two cycles don’t work – they will do a third at no additional cost.  The charge is $19,000.  A single cycle is $11,000 so we thought it would be better to opt for more tries than a one-time only. 

v  Included components:

  1. Oocyte aspiration & ultrasound guidance
  2. Oocyte identification
  3. Sperm preparation & oocyte insemination
  4. Embryo culture including prolonged culture if indicated
  5. Embryo transfer including ultrasound guidance
  6. ICSI (Intra Cytoplasmic Sperm Injection)if indicated
  7. Assisted hatching if indicated.

 v  Excluded  components:

  1. Evaluation & preparation for an IVF cycle
  2. Ovulation induction (ultrasound studies, blood tests/draws & office visits)
  3. All drugs including gonadotropins, IV solutions/infusions
  4. Anesthesia charges
  5. Cryo-preservation of embryos & storage

Plus there is a Conventional IVF monitoring cost of $3000.

Here is the website for more info:  http://infertilitysolutions.com/index.html

We know times are hard and we’re trying to come up with as much money as we can but even the smallest amount will help us have the baby we’ve wanted for years and make our family whole!  

Other ways you can help:

If you can’t help with a donation – just keeping us in your thoughts & prayers would be enough.  And please pass along our story to others by sharing this page with your family & friends!

story: Our Monastery is the oldest Orthodox Christian Monastery in America. Our summer camp reaches out to children in the surrounding area from all income brackets and in past the monastery has given scholarships to low-income children. Our kitchen is from 1969 and has not been updated since it was built. In order to stay up to code, we need to improve our kitchen with new cabinets, 2 sinks, new flooring and wall boards. The total cost will be $13,500. We do not necessariy expect to meet our goal to raise $10,000 but whatever money is donated will go directly to this project. To understand our monastery better, you can view our website at http://sttikhonsmonastery.org. Our finanacial statements are available on line at http://sttikhonsmonastery.org/files/Review-St-Tikhon.pdf. We have had a summer camp here for several decades and the staff (most of which work for free) deserve and need a better place to work and prepare the food in a safe environment. For anyone donating more than $50.00 they will receive a free CD from our 100th anniversary celebration, a beautiful Russian Orthodox a cappella choir of 100 voices (recorded live.) We thank you for any donations and ask God to reward your kindness. If you have any questions concerning this project or our monastery, please contact us directly at monasteryinfo1@gmail.com. We have been renovating the entire monastery for some time (our third world cinder block buildings) and are making the place beautiful through the support of people like you! Help us to rebuild our Monastery today!
