story:
STAY STRONG

 

I have begun a series of photographs showing the journey of people affected by breast cancer. I hope to portray and capture in my photography, this tremendous struggle and every aspect of human nature, from sadness to victory and triumph. My photography will be a photo collection of life altering, empowering and sometimes tragic series of photos showing human nature as it triumphs in many instances and succumbs in others, a real life portrayal of a disease no one wants to talk about.

My photos are just the beginning of my project. Although these photos will be dramatic in nature, I feel they will convey a story of hope, strength and life.  My photos will also bring awareness to those that may not understand this fight. My goal is to exhibit this project and publish a book of my photos and stories of people that have been affected personally from this terrible disease. I would like this book to create awareness and to give back encouragement to peoples lives. Proceeds from the sale of each book will be going to a specified breast cancer fund.

I am seeking support to help cover the costs of materials and services required to proof, print, and frame the photos. I plan on producing 20 to 30 prints for exhibition. Your support will also go to the production costs of making the book. This will include the printing, binding and packaging.

Breast cancer is more than just pink t-shirts and ribbons, but it is a battle that shouldn’t be fought alone. Everybody has the ability to help change the world, but it’s just a matter of what you can do to help. Through my photos and my book, I hope to add my part to changing the world. If you can donate, I would appreciate it. If you can't, please just share this page if you are willing. If you are a survivor of Breast Cancer or you know someone that is going though it, I want you to remember to “Stay Strong.”

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t contribute financially, please:

• Share this campaign with your friends and family

• Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, etc.

• And please don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU!

Breast cancer is more than just pink t-shirts and ribbons, but it is a battle that shouldn’t be fought alone. Everybody has the ability to help change the world, but it’s just a matter of what you can do to help. Through my photos and my book, I hope to add my part to changing the world. If you can donate, I would appreciate it. If you can't, please just share this page if you are willing. If you are a survivor of Breast Cancer or you know someone that is going though it, I want you to remember to “Stay Strong.”
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you can’t contribute financially, please:
• Share this campaign with your friends and family
• Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, etc.
• And please don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
THANK YOU!

story:
The Tim Davey Fund

http://www.indiegogo.com/timdavey

About Tim

Tim has been a friend of mine for probably 5-6 years now. He is a loving husband, father of 4, and follower of Christ. He has worked in the medical sales field for 23+ years and is currently a Senior Sales Manager. His family played a big role in my life as a single man. They constantly opened up their home to dozens and dozens of singles from our church on a weekly basis and offered encouragement, friendship, and love. Within in the last few weeks, he found out he has Aggressive Inoperable Grade 4 Brain Cancer. His family has been such a blessing to so many people with their kindness and love and I would like to see their medical bills and any other financial needs met.

What They Need

ANY DONATION AMOUNT WILL BE A BLESSING

Regardless of the amount, all funds donated will go to help Tim and his family. The funds will be donated through a church (501c3 tax-deductible) account and will be given 100% to them (minus the small percentage to Indiegogo and PayPal).

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends, family, and continue to pray for them during this challenging time.  

Note: A small $1,000 goal was set so there are no 9% penalties set if we do not meet the goal. Please give generously and help support this wonderful family that has touched so many lives!

THANK YOU!
